En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.

Doña Betty como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo invierta en su trabajo, él tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería, allí trabaja todo el día dándole forma a la madera, elabora todo tipo de muebles como camas, cajoneras entre otros productos, él realiza sus obras bajo pedido y también en ocasiones entrega en Manta a una mueblería de esa ciudad, lleva más de 4 años con su taller y con eso el lucha para que nada les falte a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura, clavos y otros materiales más para elaborar sus obras. Lleva tres años   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudarle a su marido. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of traditional products such as Panama hats and shawls famous in and outside of the country, members of the November 4th Community Bank meet every two weeks. 

This is where Betty lives. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children ages 11 and 5 who are studying in school. Her husband is a carpenter.

Betty, being the good wife that she is, is submitting this loan request for her husband to invest in his business. He has a small carpentry workshop where he works each day giving form to wood. He makes all kinds of furniture, such as beds, dressers, and other items. He makes his furniture to order and sometimes also delivers products to a shop in the city of Manta. He has been in his workshop more than four years, and it is his way of fighting to ensure that his family wants for nothing. 

This loan will go to purchasing wood, paint, nails, and other supplies for completing his work. Betty has been a member of the Community Bank for three years, and she likes that she able to help her husband through these loans. 

Her dream is to provide the best for her little ones.

loans.use: purchase wood, paint, nails, and other supplies.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru: Фарруху 18 лет. Он успешный студент и добрый по натуре человек. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Фаррух является студентом Худжандского Государственного Университета по специальности Финансы и кредит. Фаррух учится успешно и является активным студентом. Он читает много книг. Фаррух помогает родителям в свободное время от учебы по земледелию, так как земледелие является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Farruh is eighteen years old.  He is a good student and a kind-natured person.  He is not married and lives with his parents.  Farruh is a student in the Khujand State University in the department of Finances and Loans.  Farruh is successful in his studies and is an active student who reads many books.  

In his spare time, Farruh helps his parents with farming, which is the main source of income to his family.  He needs to pay for his university tuition but he does not have the money to do so.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his education.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition at the university

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 29-year-old woman from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She is married, with four children ages four months and three, seven and eight years old. 

Marites has been engaged in farming vegetables for eight years now. She produces pechay (bok choy), which is one of the staple vegetables in the country. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a sprayer. This will help her sustain her business while waiting for the harvest season.

Marites hopes that someday she can expand her business and improve the land that she cultivates for a better income. Any profit generated, will be for her children's education and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a sprayer.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh foods and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Like most traders in the same business he faces challenges of perishability and poor storage facilities. His dream is to have a modern food store. Richard intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late 30s, is married with a son who finished ordinary level school. Joyce is looking forward to taking her son to the advanced level. Since 2012, Joyce has been running a retail shop selling different items like soft drinks, dry foods, airtime, different types of soap, etc.  She is doing great in her project. Joyce works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily with the ability to earn a fair profit per month. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock the missing items in her retail shop. Joyce dreams that one day she will be able to own a big business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Muheza", which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Vecinal Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “ESFUERZO VECINAL” una de ellas es la Sra. Sherley  de 30 años soltera y con 2 hijos,la Sra. sherley se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de ropa  tanto para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y tener un ingreso mas, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra.  sherley  ha logrado mejorar su  vivienda y también la educación de sus hijos y Seguir mejorando en su negocio. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropa  y así poder tener más ingresos.la Sra. Sherley  se encuentra en medio del grupo se le distingue con polo amarillo, A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Esfuerzo Vecinal Group is made up of six responsible members engaged in a variety of commercial activities.

One of the women is Sherley, 30.  She's single and has two children.  Every day for three years Sherley has worked selling clothing for both women and men in a small shop so she can get ahead and have another income.  With the fruit of her effort she has managed to improve her home, her children's education, and her business.

She'll invest the loan in buying more clothing to have more income.

Sherley's in the middle of the group, wearing a yellow polo shirt.  She signs off with a hug for Kiva.  She's grateful for the loan granted because it makes it possible for her to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Muvafe Group

texts.es:
Muvafe es un grupo nuevo, esta en su ciclo numero uno, ellas estan esperanzadas que por medio de la ayuda de la fundación podrán ir mejorando sus vidas, gracias a las capacitaciones y las demás actividades que hacen. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia con gran entusiasmo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Gabriela, quien es la presidenta del grupo, cuenta que serlo es una gran responsabilidad, pero que lo esta haciendo muy bien. Se dedica a su negocio de Ciber, donde trabaja día a día, y gracias a que tiene muy buena clientela esta saliendo adelante. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su ciber y también para mantenimiento de sus computadoras. Agradece por esta ayuda que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Muvafe is a new communal bank in its first loan cycle.  The members hope that through the help from the foundation they will be able to improve their lives thanks to the training and other activities they will be involved in.  They are all heads of household who are very enthusiastic.

One of the members is Gabriela, who is the president of the group and believes her role carries a lot of responsibility, but she is doing it very well.  She runs an Internet cafe where she works every day.  Thanks to the very good clientele she has, things are prospering.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her Internet cafe and for computer maintenance.  She is grateful for this support which will be very helpful.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Internet cafe and for computer maintenance.

loans.name: Lapacho Florido Group

texts.es:
El grupo lapacho florido esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, de donde se pudo tener que algunas de las integrantes se encuentran con ingresos muy bajos, pero ellas están trabajando por mejorarlo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Teresa, quien tiene una pequeña, pero bien surtida despensa, la cual con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está sacando adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, comestibles, arroz y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Lapacho Florido Group is part of the "Poverty Stoplight" program (read more about this below), in which some of its members may have very low income though are working to improve that situation.

One of the group's members is Teresa, who has a small but well-stocked bodega which, through a lot of sacrifice and hard work, she is striving to make successful. She is a very hardworking person who is fighting to get ahead.

Teresa is requesting this loan in order to purchase beverages, sodas, grocery items, rice, and other products in order to continue making sales and thereby ensure that her customers are getting everything they need.

loans.use: purchase beverages, sodas, groceries, rice, and other products.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Agustin está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La Sra. Estela es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la confección y venta de sábanas, colchas y novedades artesanales. Es una persona muy luchadora y responsable.
La Sra. Estela solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales para sus confecciones como ser telas e hilos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group known as San Agustin is in the tenth lending cycle of its women's committee program, in which everyone works and helps each other get ahead. 

Estela is one of the members, and she earns her living making and selling sheets, comforters, and handcrafted novelty items. She is a very determined and responsible person. 

Estela is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for her creations, such as fabric and thread. This will help her to realize her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry; está en su ciclo número  5  del programa de comité, donde todas y cada una de ellas están luchando por crecer y salir adelante con el esfuerzo que están haciendo. Ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Zunilda es una de las miembros, quien con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella vende empanadas, milanesas, asaditos, y bebidas también se debe destacar el esfuerzo que está poniendo por mejorar e ir creciendo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, jugos, carnes, huevos, para la elaboración de las comidas; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Katupyry” group is in cycle #5 in the committee program.  Each and every one of them is striving to grow and to get ahead by means of the effort they are making.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to determine each of their situations.

Zunilda is one of the members who with much effort and sacrifice is getting ahead by means of her work.  She sells turnovers, breaded steak, grilled meat and beverages and the effort she’s putting into growing and improving should be pointed out.

She’s asking for this loan to buy beverages, soft-drinks, juices, meats and eggs, among others  to prepare the meals which will help her reach her business plan which in turn will help her to continue improving her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soft-drinks, juice, meat and eggs.

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban is 42 years old; he is married and the father of one son. He raises cows for milk purposes and has four years of experience in this field. His business brings him a stable income of 180 AZN. He has permanent buyers; however, there is only one problem he has now, which is the absence of water. Now, in order to water his cows, he has to herd them about 1 kilometer to the nearest river.

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 1,800 AZN loan. A water channel is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment. Qurban will use this loan to pay for special equipment rentals like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig up the land. He has a good loan history and this is his second loan. Qurban awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment rentals like a tractor for making a water channel.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a su hermana. La actividad de Sarita consiste en la venta de bebidas bien heladas, de manera constante recibe en su casa al representante de la empresa distribuidora quien se encarga de anotar su pedido para que al día siguiente le envíen la cantidad solicitada de acuerdo a su capital, luego sencillamente los coloca en su congelador y espera la llegada de sus eventuales clientes que acuden a su local en busca de obtener la bebida más refrescante para calmar la sed. Trabaja sola por más de 2 años. Aunque su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar a cubrir los principales gastos en su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.800, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente mayor cantidad de bebidas gasificadas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sarita is 24 years old, is single with no children. She lives in her mother's house along with her sister. Sarita sells ice cold drinks. The representative of the distributing company comes to her house on a constant basis to take her order and on the following day sends the desired amount depending on her capital. Then she simply puts them into her freezer and waits for clients to come to her location to find the most refreshing drinks to quench their thirst. She has done this for more than two years. Although her business produces good results, she still feels that it is not enough to cover the principal household expenses.

Sarita is requesting 800 PEN with this loan which she will use to buy a progressively greater amount of soft drinks wholesale. She is pleased to know that she has this financial support in order to continue advancing toward her goals. She promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Perpetuo Socorro está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, trabajando todas ellas para poder salir adelante e ir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Romina,  quien es una persona muy trabajadora, que está luchando y esforzando cada día por salir adelante. Es manicurista  y por medio de su oficio está ayudando a familia y están saliendo adelante. Quiere seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su trabajo, es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, algodón, alicates, corta uñas y demás productos para poder salir adelante. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Perpetuo Socorro [Perpetual Aid] group is in its first loan cycle with the committee program.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey.  Three of them are below the poverty line, and all of them are working to get ahead and continue growing.

One member is Romina, a hardworking person who is fighting and making an effort every day to succeed.  She is a manicurist and through her work she's helping her family and they are getting ahead.  She wants to keep growing and investing in her work, so she is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of nail polish, cotton, cuticle nippers, nail clippers, and everything else she needs.  She's grateful for the help she's getting to enable her to succeed.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, cotton, cuticle nippers, nail clippers, and other products.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 27 years old from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 5 and 8. For six years now, she has been farming vegetables like eggplant for an income. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy farm inputs like pesticides, seeds and a sprayer. 

She works hard for her children. She hopes that with her business profitability she can earn more income and provide for her children's education. She dreams of becoming more successful in farming for her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and a sprayer.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a 39 year old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. She has 2 children aged 3 and 11 years old. She farms, growing and selling rice. She has been growing rice for almost 10 years. Her husband is a carpenter. To finance her farming livelihood, she requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and laborers' fees. In the future, Marites would like to expand her farming business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and laborers' fees.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 40 años, está casada con Dedmer de 49 años y es padre de sus 02 menores hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Diana se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. Todas las mañanas instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres y pone a la venta todos los platos que prepara con mucho esmero, además también pone a la venta diversos refrescos elaborados con frutas típicas. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes mayormente son sus propios vecinos y la recomiendan a otras personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Se inició hace 3 años, inicialmente vendía poco pero con el paso del tiempo fue incrementando la cantidad de platos de acuerdo a la demanda de sus pedidos. Hasta el momento trabaja sola pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su hermana. Comenta que le gusta su trabajo porque siempre sintió pasión por el arte culinario, además al ver las ganancias económicas que obtenía, no dudó en emprender este negocio y generar su propia fuente laboral. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos como arroz, orégano, huevos, pescados y otros productos que usa para la preparación de comidas regionales.
texts.en:
Diana, who is 40 years old, is married to Dedmer, who is 49 years old. He is the father of their two dependent children, who live with them in the house that they own. 

Diana earns her living selling regional foods. Every morning, she sets up her table in front of her parents' house and sells all the dishes that she has carefully prepared. She also sells various cold drinks made with local fruits. She serves her customers very courteously; the majority of them are her own neighbors. They recommend her to other people who then, with time, become regular customers. She began three years ago, initially selling very little, but with the passage of time she has gradually increased the quantity of servings in accordance with customer demand. So far, she has worked alone with the occasional help of her sister. She says that she likes her work because she has always been passionate about the culinary arts; after seeing the money she was earning, she felt no hesitation about establishing this business and generating her own source of employment. 

At this time, she is requesting 2,000 PEN. She is vary happy to know that she will have financial support, because now she feels sure of being able to continue to run her business. With the requested amount, she will buy ingredients and supplies like rice, oregano, eggs, fish, and other products that she uses to prepare her regional dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies like rice, oregano, eggs, fish, and other products.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five young school-age children. She engages in the retail business, selling crab. She has been selling crab for almost ten years. Her husband helps her in her livelihood activity, to earn a living. She requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy more fresh crabs to resell. In the future, Mirasol hopes that she will improve her business and provide her children with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to resell

loans.name: Esperanza Y Futuro  (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza Y Futuro que se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”, por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Erika, tiene 23 años de edad,  desde los 12 años  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 10, 9, 6  y 5 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Doña Erika desde hace muchos años atrás aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad, con estos conocimientos ella empezó a realizar trabajos de tinturado y cortes de cabello, tinturados que ella sabe hacer de una forma muy especial, razón por lo cual ella tiene muchos clientes que la buscan en su casa  o la  llaman para que les vaya a realizar estos trabajos a domicilio. Gracias a los créditos ha podido comprar varias herramientas que necesita para brindar un mejor servicio y es así como ha logrado mejorar su clientela por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar unas tenazas, una plancha de cabello, esmaltes y tintes materiales útiles para su trabajo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda el banco. 

Su sueño es tener un gran salón de belleza.

La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Esperanza y Futuro [Hope and Future Communal Bank] group meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Calceta, known by the name “Calceta, a city without equal” due to the beauty of its women and because, for those who live there, there is no city more beautiful in the entire world.

This is a group of people who, some time ago, decided to meet and form this communal bank that has served them well to improve their small businesses. The members work in a variety of jobs such as retail, the service industry, and the sale of meals, among others.

One of the group members is Erika, who is 23 years old. Since the age of 12 she has been in a common-law relationship with a man. Together they have four children, ages 10, 9, 6, and 5, all of whom are school students. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

Some time ago, Erika learned cosmetology in a local academy. With those skills she began to work giving haircuts and dyes, using a special technique. Because of this, she has many clients who seek her out in her home or who call her in to their homes to work. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to buy various tools that she needs to offer improved service, and thus has managed to improve her clientele for the good of her family.

This loan is to buy a curling iron, straightening iron, nail polish, and hair dye--useful tools for her business. She has been part of the Communal Bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the help it provides.  Her dream is to own a great beauty salon.

The small photo is of three bank members who could not be present when they took the group photo.

loans.use: to buy a curling iron, a hair straightener, dye, and nail polish.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a hair dresser and a widow aged 38 years. She is also a mother of three. She has been in this business for 13 years and this is where she has got all the money to pay school fees for her children. She is applying for UGX 1,000,000 to buy more hair relaxing products and meet the demands of her clients. She hopes to pay back the loan within 6 months using the profits from the loan and also buy land to build a house for family with the next loan she hopes to get.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers and gels.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 13 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mabel, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, pero ella es consciente que trabajando es la única forma en la que podrá ir mejorando. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es Empleada, y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases. Es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por ir mejorando cada día.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser camisas, jeans, remeras y demás prendas lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in the program’s cycle #1 where they are all working and helping each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey; 13 of the members are below the poverty line with very low income.

One of the members is Mabel who in the previous survey was at poverty level 1.  She’s aware that work is the only way by which she can start to improve.  She’s a very hardworking person who is striving to improve more every day.  She says that among the work she does is being an employee and on weekends she works selling all types of clothes.

She’s asking for this loan to buy clothes like shirts, jeans, t-shirts and other articles of clothing that will help her reach her business plan which in turn will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
l grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras; está en su ciclo número  7  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas está recibiendo capacitación y de esa forma ir mejorando sus vidas. También están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda, quien vende lencería de todo tipo, tanto para hombres como para mujeres. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias al trabajo que viene haciendo puede ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para salir adelante y que no les falte nada.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas interiores de hombres y mujeres y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" group is in their seventh cycle with the Women Living in Poverty Program. They are receiving  training and in this way improving their lives. They are also participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey so each member can understand their own situation.

Zunilda is one member and she sells underwear of all sorts, for men as well as women. She is very hard-working. Thanks to this effort she can help support her family, give them what they need to get ahead and have everything they need. 

Zunilda is asking for this loan to buy men and woman's underwear to be able to continue with her business and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear to re-sell.

loans.name: Temurjon

texts.ru: Темурджону 20 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями и 2 братьями. Темурджон отлично учился в школе и после окончания средней школы он поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет в факультет Кибернетики. Темурджон имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания пшеницы и картошки, а также он занимается скотоводством. Темурджон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Temurjon is 20 years old.  He is not married and lives with his parents and two brothers.  Temurjon studied excellently in school and was accepted to the Cybernetics department of the Tajikistan State University after graduating from school.  Temurjon has an additional income from growing wheat and potatoes and is also involved in animal husbandry.  Temurjon has to pay for his tuition contract, but does not have money.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Helena, who was born late 1970s, is married with four children, all of whom are in school. For twelves years now, Helena has been running a genge-duka business selling fruits and vegetables and sweets, maize flour, baking flour, soaps of different kinds, etc. She sells all of these items at the same shop.  Helena works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to earn a small profit per month. 

This will be her 15th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Helena used her previous loans to restock more genge-duka items and has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the profit earned, she has covered school fees, household expenses and bought a plot of land where she built a house. She  also added another room. Helena will use this loan to restock more on her genge-duka items (fruits, vegetables, sweets, maize flour, baking flour ,etc). Helena dreams that one day she will be in a position to do international business. 

Helena will share this loan with her loan group" riziki " which has 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more on her genge-duka items (fruits, vegetable, sweets, maize flour, baking flour, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing her house

loans.name: Sumaiah

texts.en: Sumaiah is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She has a boutique business and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy more clothes and shoes. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people but on retail basis only six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked boutique and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is a 42 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 5 children. The oldest is 16 while the youngest is 6. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish. Aside from fishing, Modesto is also into seaweed farming. He grows and sells seaweed, to augment more income. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seaweed seedlings. In the future, Modesto would like to expand and manage it well to provide his children with quality education and improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Dellita

texts.en:
Dellita is 28 years old from Jagna, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 1 to 8 years old. She has been in the business of raising hogs to help augment the income of her husband who works as a baker.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, piglets and supplements. She is determined to improving her business profits by looking after her hogs well. 

In the future, she hopes to have other business opportunities and a bigger piggery for a better income. Her income will be for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglet and supplements.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 34 years old and a hardworking man. He has four children, and he lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a mechanic, and he also trades in old motorcycles and timber. Inadequate capital, and customers not paying him on time, are his major challenges. His dreams are to own a modern garage and to construct a permanent, residential house. Stephen intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand, for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand, for his house.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad, aged 52, is a father of eight children and a poultry farmer, from Wakiso district. He started farming in 2010 with UGX 500,000 in capital, after his previous business got burned, in Juba, Southern Sudan. He now has birds worth UGX 10,000,000 because of his hard work.

Muhammad is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. He will use it to buy feed for the birds, and to buy more birds for the December season. He will use the profits generated by the loan: to pay back the loan installments, and to build more rooms that will accommodate more birds. He also expects to pay school fees and complete his house, from the income generated by the loan. He is a hardworking man, and he thanks Kiva for the partnership.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed, and to buy more birds to raise for the December season.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.ru: Икрам, 44 года, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Икрама - среднее образование. Икрам в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с выделенной государством земельной доли. Благодаря упорному труду Икрама, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 голова крупного рогатого скота, а также 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Икрам обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 1 головы крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Икрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерен достроить свой незавершенный дом.
texts.en:
Ikram is 44 years old, and along with his wife they are raising their three children.  Ikram has high school education.  To supplement his family's income, he is raising livestock, a business which he started 23 years ago using the government provided plot of land.  Thanks to Irkam's hard work, today he has one head of cattle and 10 heads of sheep and goats.  His current monthly income, from this work, amounts to 10,000 KGS.  

With the goal of expanding his business, Irkam has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS from the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum & Partners to purchase one additional head of cattle.  Irkam is planning to re-invest the profits of his business into expanding his herd and into finishing the construction on his house.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a hardworking married woman with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and with the proceeds she was able to build rental houses where she earns extra income. Customers not paying on time and price fluctuation are her major challenges while her vision to buy land and build a house. Margret intends to use the loan to buy beer and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rincon Guazu Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rincon Guazu Poty está en su ciclo número 3. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, trabajando por mejorar su nivel de ingresos.
Graciela, una de ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella es vendedora de productos de primera necesidad con lo que está ayudando a su familia y quiere poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora. 
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de más productos como arroz, azúcar, yerba, fideos, etc., el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rincon Guazu Poty" is in its third loan cycle.  The members are taking the poverty elimination survey, which shows that three of the women are below the poverty line and working to improve their income.

Graciela is one of the members who is improving her situation through her efforts and hard work.  She sells staple goods and is able to help her family so she can give them everything she could not have.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur.  She is requesting a loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, spices, noodles, etc. to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El señor Eusebio tiene 50 años, es casado tiene 2 hijos aún pequeños, por quienes él y su esposa se esfuerzan por poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Comenta que siendo joven viajo en la Argentina, allí trabajó aproximadamente 10 años, gracias a ello pudo ahorrar y decidió volver al país a montar una carnicería. En la actualidad posee muchos clientes, gracias al buen trato y calidad de sus carnes.
El préstamo que pide, lo solicita para la compra de un congelador para la buena conservación de sus productos. Agradece por esta oportunidad de crecer que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Eusebio, 50, is married and has two small children.  He and his wife make every effort to give their children all they need so that they can grow up to be people of good will.

He says that when he was young he traveled to Argentina and worked for approximately ten years.  He was able to save money and decided to go back home and set up a butcher shop.  Now he has many customers because of the quality of his meats and good customer service.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a freezer for his products.  He is grateful for this opportunity to grow.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 De Diciembre está en su ciclo número 9, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 18 mujeres se encuentran mejorando su calidad de vida saliendo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marina, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir mejorando sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo. Entre el trabajo que ella hace como la cría y la venta de gallinas y huevos, también se debe destacar las ganas que tiene ella de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de galllinas ponedoras, vitaminas y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “8 de Diciembre” (December 8) is in cycle #9; they all work together to help each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey; 18 of the women are improving their quality of life and rising above the poverty line.

One of the members is Marina who in the previous survey was at poverty level one, that is to say, improving her income by means of her work.  She very much wants to get ahead and to help her family by means of her work.  Among the things she does is raising and selling chickens and eggs.

She’s asking for this loan to buy laying hens, vitamins and others which will help her to increase production and sales which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy laying hens, vitamins and others.

loans.name: Masallah

texts.en:
Masallah is a 28 year old, young client. He is married and thefather of one daughter.

Masallah has raised vegetables like potato, carrot, and pumpkins in his garden for the last 6 years. He also breeds cattle for meat purposes. Both businesses bring him a stable income of 250 AZN. However, there is a problem which prevents growing his business - a shortage of water resources for animals and for irrigation.

There are still some utility problems with the water supply in his region. People are suffering and he has to order special cars with water to irrigate his crops, especially in summertime, when the temperature reaches 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Building a water channel requires a lot of expense and is an expensive process which requires labor force and special equipment. When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment like tractors for making a water channel and for workers who will dig the land. He has a good loan history and this is his second loan.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment like tractors for making a water channel.

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat is 48 years old, married, and the father of four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family, in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. As an IDP, he receives 111 AZN per month financial support from the government, but this amount is too low to cover the family's needs. Since 2006 Hidayat has been running his own cattle-breeding business. He breeds cattle and sells milk and dairy products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Thanks to his father, who taught him how to look after cattle, he can do this work.

Hidayat usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. This is the only earned income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Hidayat applied for a loan of 1800 AZN, with which he will purchase one calf, one milking cow, and fodder. He has a good client history, and this is his sixth loan.

loans.use: to purchase one calf, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Agustin está en su ciclo número 1°  del programa de comité, están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y quieren poder capacitarse para mejorar en los emprendimientos que cada una está haciendo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Merli, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace sombrero de Karanday, venta de chicharrón, despensa también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, y el esfuerzo que están haciendo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales para hacer sus sombreros de Karanday, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “San Agustin” is in its 1st loan cycle with the Program Commitee. The members are learning to work together and they want to receive training to improve the enterprises which each of them has undertaken. These women are making the effort to eliminate poverty by understanding each members' situation.

One such member is Merli, who in the last survey demonstrated a poverty level of “2.” By means of her effort and continuous work, and the emulation of the vital comportment of a successful woman, she is now improving her situation of poverty. But, equally, she is aware that this work and effort should be continuous and permanent to achieve total success. Among her work is making “Karanday” [broad-brimmed hats, woven by hand of dried palm fronds] and, also, selling fried pork rinds. She is emphasizing the assessors' recommendations, acting on their efforts.

Merli is soliciting this loan to purchase materials for making her “Karanday” hats. The loan will aid her efforts to achieve a concrete business plan and help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making palm-frond hats by hand to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella es dueña de un servicentro, ella tiene venta de Lubricantes, nafta, gasolina. Esta situada en un lugar muy estratégico y por eso posee una gran clientela, además de eso comenta que tiene una antigüedad de más de 10 años en el ramo.
Solicita el crédito para inversión en su negocio, ya que quiere comprar lubricantes, gasolinas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y tener siempre lo que buscan los clientes.
Agradece nuevamente a la fundación paraguaya y a la Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Dominga’s from the city of Pilar.  She owns a service station.  She sells lubricants, fuel, and gasoline.  It’s located in a very strategic spot so she has a large clientele.  In addition to that, she comments that she has more than 10 years’ experience in this line of work.

She’s asking for the loan to invest in her business because she wants to buy lubricants, fuel, gasoline and others to continue with her sales and always have what customers are looking for. 

She once again thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino, de 69 años de edad, está casado con Elvira quien es ama de casa y madre de sus hijos. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia en compañía de 2 de sus hijos. Constantino se dedica a la siembra de productos agrícolas como cacao, café, plátano, entre otros. Tiene un terreno por la carretera de la ciudad es ahí donde realiza sus labores agrícolas. Se inicio hace más de 30 años, empezando de a poco con un capital propio que fue haciendo crecer con bastante esfuerzo, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos. Decidió empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener a su familia, logrando  sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindándoles una buena educación. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, comprará abono orgánico y semillas para sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Constantino is 69 years old and is married to Elvira who is a housewife and mother of his children.  He lives comfortably in his own home along with two of his children.  Constantino works at the cultivation of agricultural products like cacao, coffee, and banana among others.  He has some land down the road from the city that is where he accomplishes his farming.

He began over 30 years ago, starting small with his own capital that he has been making grow with quite a bit of effort.  So far he has accomplished it with the help of his children.  He decided to begin this activity due to the necessity of counting on an income to sustain his family, raise his children, and offer them a good education.  Therefore, seeing the good results and profits that it has left him, he wants to continue with his business and maintain it as his only sustenance.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial help he will receive to continue moving forward.  He further promises to pay his payments in a punctual manner.  With the requested amount of 2,500 PEN ($900), he will purchase organic fertilizer and seeds for his cropland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ethel Marilyn

texts.es:
Ethel es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Ethel no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
por iniciativa propia, Ethel trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ethel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará insumos para poder vender salchipollos, hamburguesas y demás frituras, de esta manera Ethel espera conseguir mayor cantidad de ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder lograr salir adelnate en bien de sus hijos
texts.en:
Ethel ia a 19 year old young woman.  She lives in the city of Chinca with her two small children.  She loves them, and they are her pride and joy.  She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She puts all of her efforts into getting her family ahead.  This is because she is father and mother to her children.  Sadly, due to the lack of financials resources and because she has to work,  Ethel has not been able to study business administration.

On her own initiative, Ethel works as a kitchen helper in a restaurant in her city.  She works every day for approximately ten hours.  She believes that it is going well for her because of her performance and the friendly way that she treats others.

Ethel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided, she will buy supplies in order to be able to sell ‘salchipollos’ [fried potatoes with fried chicken], hamburgers, and other snacks.  This way Ethel hopes to get more income, which will help her a lot in order to be able to keep moving forward for the good of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 50-year-old, married woman, from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children.The oldest child is 20, while the youngest is 8 years old. She engages in a farming business. She grows and sells rice. Her husband is a farmer, too. He helps plow the fields. She has been farming rice for more than 10 years.

She requested a loan of 4000 PHP to buy fertilizer and medicine, in order to increase the volume of her harvest. In the future, Patricia would like to expand her farming business, to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine for her rice plants

loans.name: Jeimmy Tatiana

texts.es:
Jeimmy Tatiana una joven de 18 años, le gustaría estudiar estética y cosmetología integral.
 aprender de esto para su propio bienestar  pues ella tuvo una hija y le gustaría que por medio del estudio pueda sacar a su hija adelante pues ella es madre soltera y quisiera brindarle un gran futuro a su hija pero ahora ella siente que el sustento de su trabajo es para poder comprarle las cosas a su bebe y una parte le gustaría para terminar sus estudios y tratar de lograr sus metas, pues ella se propuso terminar de estudiar, también para que su hija siga el ejemplo de estudiar y ser una gran profesional así como  la mamá de jeimmy le enseño, a salir  adelante y cumplir sus metas.  

También le gustaría estudiar estética y cosmetología integral para poder ayudar a la gente de forma de que ellos se sientan a gusto con su cuerpo y les agradezca POR su ayuda y su trabajo, para verle una gran sonrisa en sus rostros de felicidad y se vean  como ellos les gustaría verse, para poder lograr esto ella  quisiera estudiar  y tratar de que ellos se sientan bien con su trabajo,  es muy responsable, trata de cumplir todo lo que se proponga, a jeimmy también le gustaría estudiar para ayudar a sacar a su mamá adelante pero ella necesita una ayuda y oportunidad para poder lograr todo esto.
texts.en:
Jeimmy Tatiana is 18 years old and would like to study esthetics and cosmetology.  She wants to learn this for her own well-being since she has a daughter and would like to improve her daughter's life by studying.  She is a single mother and wants to provide her daughter with a great future.  Right now she works to be able to purchase things for the baby and she wants to finish her studies and try to achieve her goals, so she decided to finish her studies.  She also wants to be an example for her daughter by going to school and becoming a professional, like Jeimmy's mother taught her, so that she can succeed and achieve her goals.

She would also like to study esthetics and cosmetology so that she can help people feel comfortable with their bodies.  It makes her feel good that with her help and her work she can see a happy smile on people's faces when they see themselves as they'd like to be seen.  To achieve this, she wants to study and try to make people feel good with her work.  She is very responsible and will try to meet everything she proposes.  Jeimmy would also like to study to help her mother move forward but she needs help and an opportunity to be able to do all of that.

loans.use: to pay for her second semester in the cosmetology and esthetics program.

loans.name: Brenda Lisset

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven de 26 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro a logrado iniciar su negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios, ella trabaja alrededor e 9 horas al día y pude llegar a atender hasta 20 clientes, ya que ella no solo les ofrece equipos celulares, sino en ocasiones ofrece descarga de música para los celulares, entre otros y es por ello sus clientes siempre retornan a su negocio porque es muy amable y carismática.

Brenda está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá  comprar mas accesorios para vender en su negocio como fundas, stickers, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos parA ofrecer, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Brenda is a young woman of 26 who, through great effort and saving up money, has managed to start a business selling mobile phones and accessories. She works about 9 hours and serves up to 20 customers a day, offering not only mobile phones, but also services such as music downloads. Her customers return to her business because of her kindness and charisma.

Brenda is very grateful with Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy more accessories to sell, such as cases and stickers, among others. This will allow her to have a greater variety of products to sell, which will permit her to improve her income, and to keep fighting to achieve her greatest dream, to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy phone cases, stickers, and other items

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es: Este es  el grupo “TODO LO PUEDO EN CRISTO” conformado por  6 amigas  entusiastas, este grupo pasa  al ciclo 8 todos los integrantes del grupo se dedican a diferentes comercios. Aquilina es una de las socias ella es casada con 02 hijos mayores de edad. Aquilina  se dedica a la confección de ropa también hace arreglos de prendas  y toda clase de costuras,su trabajo le ha permitido ayudar a sus hijos cuando eran peqieños y hoy sustentarse a si misma. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar materiales de costura como hilos y telas. Lo que más desea es abrir  un taller grande para continuar trabajando. En la foto es la tercera de la izquierda usa casaca negra y lleva lentes.
texts.en:
The group “Todo lo puedo en cristo” (All I Can in Christ) is made up of six enthusiastic friends and is in its eighth cycle. All of the members of the group work in different businesses. Aquilina, one of the members, is married and has two older children. Aquilina makes clothing and also repairs them, a job that allowed her to help her children when they were young and to support herself today. 

With the loan she would be able to buy sewing materials such as thread and fabric. What she wishes for the most is to open a large shop to continue working. In the photo, she is the third from the left and is wearing a black jacket and glasses.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Alfonso Reynaldo

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Carhuaz, ubicada al norte de nuestro país, Alfonso trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos deportivos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y por ello siempre regresan a comprar sus productos.

Alfonso está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  como short, buzos, entre otros, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y atender mucho mejor a sus clientes, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 30 years old, he lives in the city of Carhuaz, located in the north of Peru. Alfonso works in his small business selling sports clothes. He works approximately ten hours per day and can attend to up to 20 customers a day. He considers that he is getting ahead with his business because he is very friendly with his customers hence why they always come back to buy his products.

Alfonso is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help that they have given him that he will be able to buy more merchandise for his business such as shorts, tracksuits and so on, with which he will have a larger variety of products and better attend to his customers. It is in this way that he will continue fighting to achieve his greatest dream: "Of having his own home and a larger business."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (tracksuits, shorts, and so on).

loans.name: Stephen Noel

texts.en:
Stephen is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. He he has been with Finance Sudan for about two years now. He knew about Finance Sudan Limited through the credit officers during their marketing schedules in the market.

Stephen is 28 years of age and a married father of two children who both go to school. He is a businessman who owns a general store that retails many mixed items. Other than the shop he has, he also has some agricultural products that are sold at home, which gives him some additional income.

Stephen is borrowing a loan worth 2,000 SSP to buy more items like milk, sugar, clothes, soaps, sodas, motorbike spare parts, and many others for his shop.

This loan will improve his life by enabling him to pay for school fees and medication for his family.

loans.use: To buy items like milk, clothes, sugar, soda, soap, motorbike spare parts, and many other items for the general store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia tiene 29 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas en Asunción, ella vive en Emboscada y todos los días bien temprano se levanta para ir a trabajar, es por eso que quiere terminar su carrera ya que su aspiración es abrir su consultorio en Emboscada y así poder tener un mejor ingreso y darle a sus hijos una mejor educación. Ella está estudiando la carrera de prótesis dental, y está muy esperanzada de poder ayudar más a si familia por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y así poder aligerarse en ese gasto.
texts.en:
Lidia, 29, buys and sells fruit in Asunción.  She lives in Emboscada and gets up early every morning to go to work.  That´s why she wants to finish her dental prosthesis degree and open a clinic in Emboscada to earn more income to give her children a better education.  She wants her degree so that she can help her family more through her work.

She is requesting a loan to pay for higher education costs to alleviate her expenses.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad como albañil con su padre. Ahora gracias a su sacrificio y ganas de trabajar estoy como oficial de créditos en un Banco.
Su meta es culminar mis estudios de Contabilidad, ascender en su trabajo y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación y también para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Jose is a very responsible, hard-working young man who started working as a bricklayer with his father when he was very young.  Thanks to his self-sacrifice and determination to work, now he is a loan officer at a bank.

His goal is to finish his accounting degree, get promoted and be in a position to give his wife and children a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan to cover his higher education costs.

loans.use: To pay for his higher education costs.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La Sra. Lorenza tiene 40 años, está casada con el Sr. Bernardo de 35 años, tienen un hijo, quien es la inspiración de ambos, y por quienes están luchando para poder darle todo lo que el se merece.
Doña Lorenza empezó con este trabajo hace mas de 1 años, aproximadamente a comienzo del año 2.012. Ella junto a su esposo estuvieron trabando por más de diez años en España. En la actualidad ella tiene una Boutique y el señor tiene un lavadero de automóviles, con mucha gente que concurre en su locales comerciales, gracias al buen trato con la que les atiende a los clientes.
Este crédito le servirá para comprar más prendas para la venta en la boutique y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 40, is married to Bernardo, 35; they have a son who inspires both of them and for whom they strive to be able to give him everything he deserves.

Lorenza started this work over a year ago at about the beginning of 2012.  They worked in Spain for more than ten years.  She currently has a boutique and her husband has a car wash.  Thanks to the good customer service they provide many people come to their shops.

The loan will serve to buy more items of clothing to sell in the boutique in order that way to continue offering good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina  vive con sus padres en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su madre es ama de casa  y su padre es empleado de una empresa. Sus metas futuras son trabajar en lo que es su profesión  y tener mejor  ingreso para poder mantenerse y ayudar a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, con lo que quiere ser una gran profesional que sea útil a las demás personas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de las clases, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar cerca de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Cristina lives with her parents in the city of San Lorenzo.  Her mother is a homemaker and her father works for a company.  Her future goal is to work in her profession and earn a better income to cover her expenses and maintain and help her family.

She is studying for an accounting degree and hopes to be a good professional and helpful to others.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her higher education costs so she can continue to study and achieve her goal.

loans.use: To for for her higher education costs.

loans.name: Charlotte Ama

texts.en:
Charlotte Ama is married to a small-scale miner. She has four children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses and to save for a rainy day.

A junior high school graduate, Charlotte currently sells soft drinks and provisions in Ebubonko (near Cape Coast). With over 12 years of experience in this trade, Charlotte sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks and provisions, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

Charlotte wants to make her business self-sustainable, as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her retail enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and provisions, which she expects will help boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married with two children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for four months.
Prossy has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges includes on and off electricity and thieves. 
Prossy is aspiring to own a full beauty salon and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Richelda

texts.en: Richelda is a 27-year-old married woman with two children aged 7 and 5. She is from Talibon, Bohol. She goes fishing and sells fish. She has been fishing for almost five years. Aside from fishing, she also goes seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more seaweed seedlings and house repair items. In the future, Richelda would like to expand both of her businesses to support the education of her children and to be able to pay her weekly loan dues.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings and house repair items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hotdog cart with a liquid gas cylinder and wholesale supplies (breads, meats, sauces, potatoes, soft drinks) and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos de 14 y 17 años.  Debido a la falta de empleo y a la necesidad de generar los ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella decidió iniciar con la venta de mercancía por catálogo, actividad que realiza desde hace un año y ha obtenido muy buenos resultados porque tiene buenos clientes, por lo tanto, ha podido apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica. La cliente es una mujer juiciosa, trabajadora, con un espíritu emprendedor que la motiva a buscar opciones para seguir avanzando; por esta razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumes, cosméticos, accesorios, lencería, cremas corporales, entre otros), para aprovechar las promociones y los descuentos que reducen el costo de los productos, así podrá tener más variedad de artículos que satisfagan los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, además aumentará el margen de ganancia por ventas. De esta manera Mary podrá avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, especialmente, convertirse en directora de ventas de la marca de productos que vende, creando la oportunidad de obtener mayores ingresos y podrá brindar a sus hijos una excelente educación universitaria y mejorará la calidad de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old, married, and a mother of two children, who are fourteen and seventeen years old. Due to lack of employment and the need to generate income to cover household expenses, she decided to start selling items by catalog. She has been doing this for a year and has obtained very good results because she has good customers. This way she has been able to help her husband carry their financial burden. 

This client is a hard working and judicious woman, whose enterprising spirit motivates her to look for options to continue moving forward. That is why she is requesting this loan, so that she can invest in purchasing wholesale merchandise (fragrances, cosmetics, accessories, lingerie, body lotions, and other items) and make the most of the sales and discounts that lower the cost of products. This will allow her to have a wider variety of items to satisfy the needs and tastes of her customers. She will also increase the profit margin from her sales. 

This way Mary will be able to take another step towards achieving her goals, particularly towards becoming sales director for the brand of products she sells. This will create an opportunity for her to obtain higher income so that she can give her children an excellent higher education and improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (fragrances, cosmetics, accessories, lingerie, body lotions, and other items).

loans.name: Wang'ae Group

texts.en:
Protas, who is in his early 30s, is married and has two children, who are in school. For five years Protas has been running a butcher shop, selling beef. He starts working at 6:00 AM and closes at 6:00 PM daily, and he is able to make a fair return per month.

This will be Protas's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use it to buy more meats to sell at his shop. He used his previous loans, both to buy more meat and to equip himself to begin slaughtering animals at his own place. He has managed to repay all of his previous loans, successfully. He is doing great in his butcher shop.

With the business profit he expects to earn, Protas will cover school fees, home expenses, and start building a house. Protas dreams that one day, he will be able to buy more cows from different up-countries. He will share this loan with his loan group, Wang'ae, which is comprised of 14 members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the group's loan.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 52 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has six children, the oldest child is 27 while the youngest is 6. Rogelio runs a vulcanizing shop. Aside from the vulcanizing shop, he also operates a spare parts mini store. He sells various motor cycle spare parts. 
To cater to the needs of his customers, Rogelio requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy several tyres. Rogelio would like to improve and manage well both his businesses to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy several tyres for resale

loans.name: Hawasata

texts.en:
Hawasata is single and has one child. She is an established businesswoman, selling footwear and  fabrics in Ebubonko (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing for about 15 years.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Hawasata  uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Hawasta is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase increased amounts of  footwear and fabrics, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of  footwear and fabrics

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
La señora  Alba  tiene 38 años, ella es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas, uno de 18 y 3 años, la mayor está cursando el primer año de la carrera de Agronomía, y la menor aun es muy pequeña, el sueño de ella es que su hija termine su estudio y pueda serle útil el día de mañana.
La señora  Alba es macatera (venta ambulante) de todo tipo de artículos, desde hace 9 años, trabajó unos cuantos años en el extranjero, estando ahí construyó para su casa y a su vuelta pudo hacer crecer más su negocio. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de vaqueros para damas y caballeros, calza, championes, blusas, capri, ropa interior y otros que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alba, age 38, is a single mother. She has two daughters, ages 18 and 3. The older is in her first year of studies to obtain a degree in Agronomy, while the younger is still very small. Her dream is that her daughter would finish her studies and can be useful in the future.

Alba has worked as a street vendor of all types of merchandise for 9 years.  She worked several years abroad in order to build her house, and upon her return she was able to grow her business.

She seeks a loan for the purchase of men’s and women’s jeans, leggings, sneakers, blouses, capris, underwear, and other items that will allow her to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy jeans for men and women, leggings, sneakers, blouses, capris, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que viene de una familia muy trabajadora. Su meta es terminar la carrera de Zootecnia y luego hacer su doctorado en producción, para así elevar su nivel de competitividad y sobresalir como profesional.
Quiere ser un profesional exitoso que pueda ayudar a las demás y ser conocido por lo que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención y de transportación y de esa forma seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
Nelson is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He says that he comes from a very hardworking family. His goal is to finish his degree in animal husbandry and then to get his doctorate in production. In this way, he will raise his ability to compete and stand out as a professional. He wants to be a successful professional who can help others and be known for what he does.

He seeks this loan to pay for his living expenses and transportation costs and, in this way, continue towards his goal.

loans.use: to pay for living expenses and transportation costs while completing his education.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
After graduating from primary school, Cecilia decided to set up her own grocery business in Ebubonko (near Cape Coast). With over 15 years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding.  As a result, this loan will be used by her to purchase more groceries for resale at her shop.

She aims at using the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale at her shop

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is a 53 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 5 children. The oldest is 30 while the youngest is 18. He engages in farming. He grows beans, eggplant, tomatoes and other vegetables. He has been farming vegetables for more than 10 years. Nestor requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and seeds, to continue his farming activity. In the future, Nestor would like to expand his farming business to continue send his children to school and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Adela lives in Jagna, Bohol, with her family. She is married with four children aged 5-18. Adela has been farming spring onions and beans for 25 years now. This business has been her very source of livelihood and helps in sustaining the needs of her family.

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, onions, and beans. Adela hopes that with the loan she can be more productive in her farm. In the future, she plans to make her farm bigger, improve land preparation, and produce more vegetables and spices so she can provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, onions, and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Guliko

texts.en:
Guliko is 36 years old, married and living in the village of Dzimiti with her husband and school-aged daughter. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business for seasonal income. Specifically, they cultivate the plot of land where maize and nuts are grown. The harvest is sold at the local market. 

Besides this, Guliko runs a dairy farm with a cow for milk. She produces dairy products with the milk and sells them from her house. As their existing income is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Guliko decided to start a clothing sales business. She requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Guliko’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. She received this credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 2,000 GEL she will purchase clothing and household items at wholesale prices and sell them in her community door-to-door. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children and bedclothes as well. It is obvious that the job is hard for Guliko, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
