Le groupe LOLO, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Baou quartier Bamanan commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales (mil mais et du riz) et du beurre de karité. Les femmes du groupe LOLO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. La cliente Sitan, première assise à droite dans le rang des assises compte acheter 30 kg de niébé pour ensuite revendre à ses clientes. Son cycle achat vente est d’une semaine. Elle compte réaliser 10.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet de couvrir les frais de condiment dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The group LOLO is composed of married women, who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children each. They all live with their traditional extended families in the Baou village, Bamanan district, Banco town, Dioila prefecture, and Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell grain (millet maize and rice) and shea butter. The women of LOLO are on their second group loan.

Sitan (right, seated in the front row) plans to buy 30 kg of black-eyed peas to sell to her customers. Her purchasing and sales cycle is one week. She plans to earn 10.000 CFA per month. This income will allow her to cover the costs of vegetables for sauces in her home.

loans.use: to buy black-eyed peas

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LOLO, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sanakorodjeda commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce céréale de céréale, de fruit et des légumes. Les femmes du groupe LOLO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. La cliente Magnan,  la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises. Elle  compte acheter 5 régimes de  banane avec son argent dans les plantations du village de Sanakorodjeda et Koula. Elle vend sa banane à Baou Foulala et à Banco. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen par cycle soit 14.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet de couvrir les frais de condiment dans son foyer et de s’occuper des enfants.
texts.en:
The group LOLO is composed of married women, who, on average, are 37 years old and have five children each. They all live with their traditional extended families in the Sanakorodjeda village, Banco town, Dioila prefecture, and Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell grain, fruit, and vegetables. The women of LOLO are on their second group loan. 

Magnan (the first person seated on the left) plans to buy five banana bunches in the plantations of Sanakorodjeda and Koula. She sells her bananas at Baou Foulala and Banco. She plans to earn an average income of 14.000 CFA per month. This income will allow her to cover the costs of vegetables for sauces in her home and care of her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sanakorodjeda commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de fruit et des légumes. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Avec ce prêt,  la cliente Awa Yacouba,  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout,  compte acheter 5 régimes de  banane avec son argent dans les plantations du village de Sanakorodjeda et Koula. Elle vend sa banane à Baou Foulala et à  Banco. Elle compte réaliser 8.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet de couvrir les frais de condiment dans son foyer et de s’occuper des enfants.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who, on average, are 37 years old and have five children each. They all live with their traditional extended families in the Sanakorodjeda village, Banco town, Dioila prefecture, and Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell fruit and vegetables. The women of DANAYA are on their second group loan. 

With this loan, Awa Yacouba (standing in the back row, second from the right) plans to buy five banana bunches in the plantations of Sanakorodjeda and Koula. She sells her bananas at Baou Foulala and Banco. She plans to earn 8.000 CFA per month. This income will allow her to cover the costs of vegetables for sauces in her home and care of her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 35 year old.  She is a married and has two children, aged 6 months old and 17; one is in school, and they all live at home. She describes herself as hard working.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Maima has a cook shop (Restaurant) business where she's been selling rice and soup over the past two years now.  She works 10 hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in her business is complaints from her customers about her food price. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice by bag, oil, pepper, vita, fish, meat, etc for her business. She started her business with money from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes to one day to build a house.

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice by the bag, oil, pepper, vita, fish, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa de Lima está en su  Quinto ciclo del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde se demuestra que dos de las señoras  se encuentran en el indicador amarillo, es decir con ingresos medios.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virginia, quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos, y por medio de ese trabajo lucha por poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella es una persona que desea capacitarse para mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Desde joven ha trabajado y no teme a hacerlo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados, y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Santa Rosa de Lima is in its fifth cycle as a communal bank, where everyone commits themselves to work and to help each other so that everyone can get ahead. They are completing a research study for the elimination of poverty. The research indicates that two of the women are in the “yellow” level, which is to say, with a mid-level income.

One of the participants is Virginia, who works selling shoes. Through her job she fights to be able to give her family what they need. She is a person who wants to train herself in order to improve her life and the lives of her family. She has worked from a young age and isn’t afraid to do so. She is thankful for this opportunity, which will be a great help to her.

She seeks this loan to be able to buy footwear, and thus to continue with her sales, just as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: La Crainte De Dieu (1) Group

texts.en: Suzanne is one of the members of the group La Crainte de Dieu (1) and is the leader of a group consisting of ten micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Suzanne is married with six children, the oldest who is 23 and the youngest who is 8 years old. This is Suzanne's second loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she began with cooking doughnuts but has expanded her activities during the past five years and now she operates a small patisserie. She will use the loan to purchase the necessary material to prepare baked goods for her clients, such as oil, sugar, and wood that she uses to prepare her fire. She has felt the pressure of increased prices on raw materials in the past and this continues to be a difficult obstacle for her to overcome. She knows that continued reinvestment of profits back into her business is the key to being able to continue to grow her activities. In the future, she has hopes to improve the housing situation of her and her family as her patisserie continues to grow.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as oil and sugar for her bakery.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a 47-year-old married man who hails from Talibon, Bohol. He has 4 children; the oldest is 23 while the youngest is 2. He operates a boat to use to transport people from one island to another. He collects a minimum fee for each ride. He has been transporting passengers for more than 10 years. Due to lack of financial capacity to maintain its operation, Rolando requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy marine ply wood, epoxy (adhesive), paint and nails, to avoid hassle and provide a comfortable ride. In the future, Rolando would like to invest to other business to expand his livelihood  and to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy marine ply wood, epoxy (adhesive), paint and nails.

loans.name: Waggwa

texts.en:
Wagwa is an electronics technician, aged 36. He is a married man and has six children. Wagwa is a repeat client, who has serviced two loans taken for school fees in the past. The children for whom he was paying school fees, have now finished school.

Now, Wagwa is borrowing UGX 1,000,000. He will use the loan funds to add stock of electronics into his business, not paying school fees this time. While he was servicing the school fee loans, he used his working capital and the amount of it was reduced because he was paying back those loans. Therefore, he wants a business loan now, to boost his business and get more revenue.

He plans to use some of his expected income to build more rental rooms, to increase his family's income. He thanks Kiva lenders for being supportive.

loans.use: To buy electronics to sell

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María con 31 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija de 10 años. Desde hace 8 años comenzó su propio negocio, un taller de confección que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside; esta idea surgió por la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que se encontraba desempleada y nunca tuvo el apoyo del padre de su hija, por lo que aprovechó los conocimientos obtenidos en este tema, gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre y montó su negocio. Actualmente tiene varios contratos con terceros, a quienes les confecciona uniformes y, hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien, pero su mayor sueño es confeccionar su línea propia. Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de una máquina de doble aguja con rodillo, con la que podrá agilizar su producción y entregar los pedidos oportunamente, esto le abrirá las puertas para tener más contratos y a mediano plazo podrá iniciar a confeccionar su línea propia, logrando mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindar a su hija una excelente educación para que tenga un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
31-year old María is a single mother with a 10-year old daughter. Eight years ago she started her own sewing business in a workshop located in her home. She came up with this plan because of the need to earn money to pay for household expenses. She was unemployed and had never received assistance from the father of her child. Because she had learned how to sew from her mother, she decided to open a sewing business.

Currently María has contracts with various parties to make uniforms. The business is doing well, but her big dream is to make her own line of clothing. This is why she is seeking a loan to buy a specialized sewing machine so she can speed up production and deliver orders more promptly. Then more doors will open up for further contracts and in the not too distant future she will be able to start making her own line of clothing. In turn this will lead to an improved standard of living and a good education for her daughter so that she can have a successful future.

loans.use: Buy a specialized sewing machine

loans.name: Luis Arley

texts.es: Luis desde que tenía 12 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar como carretillero en la plaza de mercado de la ciudad donde vive. Hoy en día, ya con 32 años de edad, trabaja en la misma plaza como empleado de un negocio de comidas rápidas, actividad que alterna con la venta de mercancía como camisetas, jeans, tennis, entre otros, de esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos y necesidades básicas de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 6 y 9 años de edad. Luis es un hombre pujante, trabajador, juicioso y emprendedor; siempre trata de aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida le ofrece, por eso se anima a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, tennis y ropa en general para mujeres, hombres y niños), con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene por compras de contado, así tendrá más variedad de artículos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, además podrá ampliar su mercado, pues ya conoce toda la plaza de mercado donde pueden haber muchos clientes potenciales, esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Esto le permitirá a Luis darle una buena educación a sus hijas y ahorrar para montar su propio negocio en un local comercial, que le genere los recursos suficientes para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Luis started working when he was twelve years old as a cart vendor in the market square of his home town. Today he is 32 years old and works in the same square for a fast food business. He alternates this job with selling merchandise like t-shirts, jeans, tennis shoes, and other items. This allows him to obtain the income he needs to cover expenses and basic needs for his family, which includes his wife and their two daughters, who are six and nine years old. 

Luis is a vigorous, hard working, judicious, and enterprising man. He always tries to make the most of the opportunities life brings him, which is why he decided to request a loan to invest in purchasing wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, tennis shoes, and clothing in general for men, women, and children). His goal is to make the most of the discounts he receives for making cash purchases. This will allow him to have a wider variety of items to satisfy his customers' needs and tastes. He will also be able to expand his market, because he is already familiar with the whole market square, which is full of potential customers. This will result in an icrease of sales and, in turn, an increase in his income. 

This will allow Luis to give his daughters a good education and to save money to set up his own business in a commercial space and generate enough income to offer his family a better quality of life in the near future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, tennis shoes, and clothing in general for men, women, and children).

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is originally from the city of Accra-Teshie. She is 50, married, and the mother of two children. She is a merchant by trade, selling groceries (soap, Milo, Cerelac, Lactogen, Cowbell, corn flakes, Sunlight and body cream). 

She has been selling these products for nine years and has enjoyed tremendous growth in business. She is requesting GHS 1600 to buy groceries (soap, Milo, Cerelac, Lactogen, Cowbell, corn flakes, Sunlight and body cream) to sell.  

Her future goal is to improve her business to grow to a wholesale level so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries (soap, Milo, Cerelac, Lactogen, Cowbell, corn flakes, Sunlight and body cream) to sell

loans.name: Pallah

texts.en:
Pallah is 38 years old and lives in the Ganta area, one of the most talked about cities in Nimba county, the second most populated county in Liberia and rich in nature resources. Pallah is married and has five children aged between 2 and 19, all live at home and attend school. 
For the past 10 years she has been running a shop selling rice, oil, milk, sugar, slippers, etc. Pallah has requested this loan to purchase more biscuits, rice, oil, milk, sugar, slippers, etc., in order to turn her business into a bigger one. The problem she’s faced with is small capital. 
She started this business by selling for her mother on a table market and learned this from friends. What she likes about this business is that she meets new people and makes profit every day; it makes her proud to have money in her home every day. She spends eight hours on her business every day, and uses the bus to get her goods from the wholesale center. In future she wants to open another shop in the next community.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, rice, oil, milk, sugar, slippers, etc. in order to turn her business into a bigger one.

loans.name: Baxtiyar

texts.en:
Baxtiyar is a 36-year-old married father of 3 kids. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in a central bazaar and from his home. Baxtiyar has 10 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and also make fresh punch. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

He applied for 1900 AZN loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover. This will be his 6th loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Modesta, who is in her mid 40s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been running a hardware shop business for four years now. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Modesta's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her hardware stock and also bought the missing stock for her shop. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy land and has built and completed her small house. She also covered household expenses and paid school fees as well. She will use this loan to buy more stock of hardware to resell.  She dreams of buying sheets of iron.

Modesta will share this loan with her loan group "Mt. Livingstone" with twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  hardware to resell.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two young sons. Samar lives in a simple house in Qalqilia city with her family. 

Samar's husband is a farmer, and he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. He gets a low income because of the seasonal crops and the expensive farming supplies. Samar sews some clothes for local customers and gets cheap prices so she can help her husband in part of the family expenses. 

Samar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. By applying this loan, Samar will be able to help her husband with part of the family expenses. This will improve the family living conditions.

Samar appears in the photo in her small sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 39 years old, married and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shahnaz has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is 45 years of age. She has been running a business of milk sales for about three years. She has one buffalo and sells milk to many of her neighbors, making enough to contribute to the family income. She has three children, all in school. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet all household expenses. She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education.  She has some past savings and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales of milk. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Rebecca Esi

texts.en: Rebecca Esi is a small-scale food vendor who sells maize porridge and bread in Ebukonku (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Rebecca has been working as a food vendor for close to  10 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize porridge and bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a porridge and bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of maize porridge and bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Fatima Ama

texts.en:
Fatima Ama is a small-scale ‘banku’ seller.  ('Banku' is a traditional Ghanaian dish, made with fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste.) She primarily sells her ‘banku’ in Ebubonko (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Fatima has been preparing and selling ‘banku’ for close to four years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

Fatima plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize and cassava, which will enable her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of establishing a ‘banku’ stand, so she may sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize and cassava, with which she plans to prepare and sell more banku.

loans.name: Andrea Gissella

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Aquí vive la señora Andrea, tiene 28 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El esposo es comerciante.

Doña Andrea para ganar algo por su cuenta y ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00, aprovecha que a esta hora esta su hijo en la escuela y solo tiene que llevar al más pequeño,  ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad que le deja buenos ingresos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas y camisetas, ella va a provechar que son las fiestas de la ciudad y allí se vende mucho de su mercadería. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The "Union of Women" Community Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known by the name "Calceta, without compare" because of the beauty of its women and because for its inhabitants, there isn't a more beautiful city in the world.

Here lives Andrea.  She is 28 years old and has a common-law marriage, through which she has two children, ages 5 years and 2 years.  The older one goes to school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

Andrea, to earn something on her own and to help with household expenses, makes her living selling all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door and also from her house, where her most familiar customers come.  She works everyday from 8:00 until 11:00, making the most of this time that her son is at school and she only has to take along the younger one.  She sells to her customers on credit and collects once a week.

She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to.  She has had this business for more than 5 years, and it gives her a good income.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, like:  pants, blouses and t-shirts.  She is going to take advantage of the fact that it is the city festival, and she sells a lot of her merchandise there.

She has taken four loans with the Community Bank, and she likes it for the support they have given her.  Her dream is that her children not want for anything.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
The “Tamaraneh” group consists of small scale businessmen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which they will use to invest in their respective businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Alhassan, who is 48 years old, married, and has five children who attend school.  He was born in Kambia but now lives and works in Koidu. His wife is a tailor. Alhassan has been a businessman for 11 years, selling shoes. With his share of this loan, he will buy a wide variety of shoes and in large quantities to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Xatira

texts.en:
Xatira is 60 years old and the mother of five children. She has a big family. Xatira is a merchant in her hometown. She opened a clothing store near her home and is working to develop it into a steady business. She sells women's clothing and household things, which she gets from other cities. Her elder son helps her to sell goods.

Xatira is dedicated to seeing her business thrive, but she is taking only small steps, to ensure that she does not expand too rapidly and incur large debts. Her profit from this business is 170 AZN per month. She wants to move her store into a major shopping center, so she is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN. Her good client history is proof of her ability to repay.

loans.use: to move her store into a major shopping center

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 37-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She is been in this line of work for 18 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Najma was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis. That compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Up to that point, her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. She has a four children. Najma felt obligated to improve her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. So she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: La Crainte De Dieu (2) Group

texts.en:
Dassin is one of the members of the group La Crainte de Dieu (2) and is the leader of the group consisting of eight micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 
Dassin is married with three children, the oldest who is 16 and the youngest who is just five months old. This is Dassin's fourth loan cycle with HOPE Congo and he has been operating a small shop which he started in 2001 selling bread. He will use the loan to purchase some additional goods for his store, such as additional drinks, soap, and cooking oil. Like many others, Dassin has felt the pressure of increased prices on his inventory but insists that prayer is a core part of overcoming these obstacles. He realizes that continued reinvestment of profits is critical to grow his activities. In the future, he wishes to be able to take his family on a vacation outside of Brazzaville and to provide all of his children with a high quality of education for their own futures.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his store, such as soft drinks, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 31-year-old, divorced lady. For the past six years, she has been running a business of clothing sales. She buys clothes of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from a wholesale market. Later, she sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan to buy a wide variety of clothes, in different colors and designs, to expand her inventory and attract more customers. Shahnaz expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes, in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nancy Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores  de edad que estudian en  colegio dos de ellos  aun viven con ella a pesar de que una ya está casada vive allí junto a sus esposo y dos pequeños. Su esposo es maestro constructor. 

Doña Nancy es modista de profesión y trabaja en un taller de costura de una señora para lo cual recibe un sueldo semanal, pero en las noches ella también por su cuenta se dedica a coser ropa, en especial vestidos de niñas que es lo que más le gusta confeccionar aunque también elabora bastantes prendas de damas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Lleva más de 27 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un taller propio.
texts.en:
The Unión de Mujeres Community Bank meets twice a month in the beautiful town of Calceta, known as "Calceta, a town without equal" because of the beauty of its womenfolk and because, according to its citizens, there is no more beautiful town in the world.

This is where 54-year old Nancy lives. She is married and has four adult children who attend college. Two of them still live with her even though one is already married and lives there with her husband and two little ones. Her husband is a builder.

Sra. Nancy is a dressmaker and works for a woman who pays her a weekly wage. However, at nights Nancy works independently sewing clothing especially little girls' clothes, her favorite. She does make a lot of clothing for women also. Her orders come from private individuals.

Nancy has had her business for more than 27 years and her earnings help her husband pay for household expenses. She will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies. 

Nancy is a founding member of this community bank and likes it for the loans it extends to members. Her dream is to have a workshop of her own.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Percila

texts.en:
Percila is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in farming. She grows rice, and has been doing so for more than 10 years. Aside from farming, She makes hats. She sells hats made of buri (palm).

Percila requested a loan of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy two sacks of fertilizers and one sack of rice seedlings, and to pay laborers' fees. These will help her to have a bountiful harvest.

In the future, Percila would like to expand her farming business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizers and one sack of rice seedlings, and pay laborers' fees.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for four years. She generates additional income by making paper bags. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more rolls of clothing material and spools of thread. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, at retail.  Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a tailoring school and to build a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and thread.

loans.name: Sharkiya

texts.ru: Шаркия добросовестная женщина. Ей 32 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Шаркия живет вместе со своей матерью. Она давно мечтает организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она является опытной портнихой. Шаркия запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки 2 швейных машинок, чтобы организовать бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sharkiya is a conscientious woman.  She is 32 years old, divorced, lives with her mother and has no children.  She has long dreamed of starting her own business.  To this end, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" program, organized by the Association of Business Women.  She successfully graduated from the course and received a certificate of completion.  Now, she is ready to start her own business.  Since she is a talented seamstress, she wants to start making clothes for women and for children.  Sharkiya is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni (TJS) to buy two sewing machines for her new enterprise.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines to launch her new business

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is 40 years old.  He is married and lives in his own house with his wife and daughters. He sells food products like cakes, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 10 years. He started with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

He is now requesting 1,800 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. He has a good loan history. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn strives hard to give her children their basic necessities and to provide for their children's needs in school. She hopes that her children will someday finish a degree in college and have decent jobs. 

Evelyn has had a farming business planting rice in their field for many years. Sometimes she has difficulties sustaining her farm needs as she also provides her children's allowances in school. In this connection, Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP43,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides that she will apply to her crop. Evelyn is hoping for a better yield and to increase her income to further sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam is a 42-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for a period of about 15 years. She has two cows and three calves. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She also works in animals sales on a seasonal basis to generate extra profits. She is a mother of four children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- to buy one more cow to increase her sales of milk. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 48 years old and comes from the community of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with ten children ages 16-30. For a year now, she has been engaged in a 'sari-sari' (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, cigarettes, snacks and toiletries. Her income helps her husband, who is a carpenter, in supporting their family.

Delma is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy items like canned goods, laundry soap and candies. The income will be used for family consumption and to pay for household bills.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and make it more profitable so she can provide for her children's education and possible house renovation.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, laundry soap and candies

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 12 years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more rice, grains and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. It’s her seventh year with Kashf foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, who is 37 years old and married, is from the village of Union. She is engaged in direct selling business in their village. She loves her family so much, she does everything for her family to sustain their needs. Due to insufficient funds she is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 to buy cosmetics products to sell such as talc powder,lotions, soap, shampoo and detergent powder to sell. She hopes that her business expands so that she can improve their way of living.

loans.use: To buy talc powder,lotions, soap, shampoo and detergent powder to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 62-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish, and has been involved in this business for almost two years now.

Adela is in need of materials that are very helpful in her fishing activities, so she requested a loan of 15000 PHP to buy fishing nets and lift weights, to increase her catch and gain more income. 

In the future, Adela would like to expand her fishing business to purchase a new fishing boat, to make her livelihood activity more progressive and provide a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and lift weights.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 32-year-old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 5, 6 and 11. For 10 years now, she has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sell items like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, seasoning, snacks and toiletries.
 
Narcisa is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy items like soft drinks, detergent, canned goods, eggs, noodles and seasoning.  The income will be used for her children's schooling and family consumption.

In the future, she hopes to expand her store and offer more merchandise for a better profit. This way she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, detergent, canned goods, eggs, noodles and seasoning

loans.name: Mariela De Los Angeles

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Aquí vive la señora Mariela, tiene 43 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 14 y 13  años de edad, los dos menores estudian  en colegio, todos ellos aun viven en su casa. El esposo trabaja de oficial en un bus de transporte.

Doña Mariela para ganar algo por su cuenta y ayudar con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos hace más de seis años empezó un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y bocadillos, ella con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió de la institución compro lo necesario para preparar alimentos para entregar en fiestas y recepciones. Todos los fines de semana tiene contratos para preparar la comida que se van a servir en todo tipo de compromisos sociales, trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos más que todo en la entrega de los alimentos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.

 Su sueño es que a sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Unión De Mujeres Community Bank meets in the beautiful city of Calceta, known by the name "Calceta without equal" for the beauty of its women and because for its residents there is no city more beautiful in the world.

This is where Mariela lives. She is 43 years old and is in a common law relationship, by which she has four children who are 21, 19, 14, and 13 years old. All her children live at home with her, and her two youngest children are enrolled in high school. Her husband works as an official bus driver. 

In order to cover her share of the household expenses and schooling for her children, Mariela opened a small convenience store six years ago where she sells foodstuffs and snacks. With the assistance of her first loan she purchased the necessary supplies to prepare meals to deliver during parties and receptions. Each weekend she is contracted to prepare food that will be served during all kinds of social events. She works together with her children to cater all of these meals. 

This loan will be used to purchase grocery items for preparing meals. Mariela has been a member of this community bank for six years and she likes it because she was able to start her business with her first loan. 

Her dream is to have all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: purchase groceries

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira is 42 years old, married and a mother of four. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch more dresses on time. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. Her youngest child is 14 year old. She engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. She has been growing rice for more than 10 years. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides. In the future, Rosalina would like to expand her farming business to provide her family with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is a small-scale baker who bakes bread for sale in Ebubonku (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has two children.  Her husband is a driver.  Agatha has been working as a baker for close to five years.  Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour, allowing her to meet her customers’ rising demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying an additional oven and a bread stand, helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour for her bakery

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married with four children and all of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a stationery shop and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of books, pencils and pens. 

Sylvia generates additional income through teaching. She works in the shop five days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She aspires to own a fully-stocked stationery shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of books, pencils and pens.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married, 27 years old, and resides with her family at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Flordeliza runs a business in the local community, selling seafood products, including crabs, fish and shrimp, to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman, and fishing is their main source of income.

In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to repair the boat. She borrowed a new loan recently, which she used to purchase more seafood for sale. In the future, Flordeliza wants to expand her business, to gain higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood for sale

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 48-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for the past 15 years. She sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has seven children, three of whom are school going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business but she needs money to purchase another buffalo. So, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Walter Humberto

texts.es: Walter, a sus 24 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como oficial de construcción, actividad que alterna con la producción y comercialización de leche, ya que de manera independiente cuenta con 8 vacas lecheras; la producción que obtiene la vende a una empresa de lácteos del municipio donde reside y, de esta forma obtiene los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El cliente es un hombre pujante y con un espíritu emprendedor que lo motiva para seguir luchando y lograr los objetivos que se propone. Ha sobrepasado muchos obstáculos, especialmente debido a los bajos precios de venta del líquido, pues hay sobreoferta en el mercado y adicional a eso, se ve afectado por las importaciones que realiza el gobierno. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de ganado de levante (12 terneras de levante) y cancelar el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente; con esto podrá ampliar su producción no sólo de leche, sino que complementará incursionando en el mercado cárnico, así podrá darle continuidad a su negocio, con lo que podrá incrementar sus ingresos para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, además podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter, at 24 years of age, is married and doesn't have children.  He currently makes his living working as a construction worker, which he alternates with milk production and sales, since he independently owns 8 dairy cows.  He sells the milk he gets to a dairy business in the municipality where he lives, and in this way, he gets the necessary income to bring home the daily bread.

The borrower is a hardworking man with an enterprising spirit, which motivates him to continue striving and to achieve the goals he sets for himself.  He has overcome many obstacles, especially because of the low prices for milk sales, due to the oversupply in the market. In addition to this, he has been affected by government importations.  

This is motivating him to apply for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of livestock to raise (12 calves) and to pay off the loan that he has outstanding.  With this, he will be able to expand his production, not only of milk, but he will also complement it by breaking into the beef market.  This way he will be able to continue his business and increase his earnings in order to continue moving towards meeting his goals.  He will also be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise (12 calves) and to pay off the loan that he has outstanding.

loans.name: Salomatkhon

texts.ru:
Саломатхон прекрасная мать, жена. Ей 47 лет. У нее огромное сердце и чистая душа. Она мать-героиня, у нее 6 детей и все у нее воспитаны. Ее старший сын работает главой дехканского хозяйства, а невестка учительницей местной школы. Четверо ее детей еще учатся в школе. 
Климат ее милого городка благоприятны для выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур, а также для животноводства. В течение 6 лет Саломатхон и ее муж занимаются куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Она любит свою работу. Саломатхон и ее муж намерены расширить свою деятельность в области животноводства. И просят кредит чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Саодатхон в ближайшем будущем хочет женить второго сына и принести в дом вторую невестку.
texts.en:
Salomatkhon is a wonderful mother and wife.  She's 47 and has a huge heart and pure soul.  She's a mother-heroine--she has 6 children, all of them well-bred.  Her eldest son is the head of a family farm and her daughter-in-law teaches at a local school.   Four of her children are still in school.  

The climate in her pleasant little town is favorable for growing crops and raising livestock.  Over the past 6 years Salomatkhon and her husband have earned their living buying and selling small livestock.  Salomatkhon loves her work.  She and her husband are determined to expand their livestock business.  They're seeking a loan so they can get more head of cattle.  In the near future Salomatkhon would like to marry off her second son and bring a second daughter-in-law into the household.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 23-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of animal sales and purchases to contribute to the family income. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and raises them. Then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Please meet Lorena from Liberia. She lives and works in Nimba County. Nimba is one of the most resource rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people pass through the area on business, bringing lots of trade. It is also the second most populous area in Liberia. 

Lorena completed 12th grade before getting married. Her husband is a doctor. She has four children between the ages of one and eight. Only two are in school and they all live at home. 

On average, she works nine hours on her business. She started her business by working for her mother. She transports her merchandise by bus. She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is making more profit. In the future, she would like to own a house.  

Lorena has a table business where she has sold quilts, bedsheets, etc. for the past three years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more quilts, bedsheets, etc. for her business.  

She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more quilts, bedsheets, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una persona muy trabajadora, que gracias a su despensa pudo ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella utilizo su crédito anterior en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser fideos, azúcar, harina, panificados y demás artículos. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
Hoy solicita de un nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en panificados, yerba, azúcar y demás insumos para que pueda seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Marina is a hardworking woman, who thanks to her store has been able to help her family and provide them with everything they need.  She used her previous loan to purchase supplies for her store such as noodles, sugar, flour, baked food and other items.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received.  Today she is asking for a new loan to use to purchase baked goods, yerba mate, sugar, and other supplies so she may be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: purchase baked goods, yerba mate, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité  Primavera, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las integrantes, están en el 1er ciclo, con 15 integrantes, ellas están a 80 km de Curuguaty, en la localidad de Yjhovy, una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica. Todas ellas son mujeres que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades agrícolas.
Antonia, una de ellas, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada, y comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo ayuda a su familia y logra tener para el día a día.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Primavera committee was formed with the initiative of one of its members; they're in the first loan cycle with 15 members. They are 80km from Curuguaty, in the village of Yjhovy, a zone well isolated from the central zone. All of them are women, who, in the majority, make their living through agricultural activities. Antonia, one of them, makes her living raising and selling barnyard animals like hens, pigs, goats and more. She is a very self-sacrificing person and thanks to her efforts she helps her family and achieves having enough for day-to-day.

Today she is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of feed for her animals and therefore continue working.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Elsa Albina

texts.es:
Elsa es una joven de 19 años de edad, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de panes y refrescos naturales, vive junto a su compañero de vida y tienen en común una hija que aún no tiene el año de nacida. Ella además de ser ama de casa, también es la encargada junto a su compañero de vida de preparar la venta de cada día para que esta sea distribuida en comunidades aledañas.

Todos los insumos que necesita para elaborar la venta diaria, la compra por grandes cantidades para que el precio sea menor en vista, que si ella compra de forma individual o por cantidades pequeñas el precio se incrementa y la ganancia que queda en el negocio es poca, se trastada hasta la ciudad que esta a 35 kilómetros, también existen tienda en la comunidad donde compra sus insumos para no tener que gastar en pasaje todos los días, que por la naturaleza tiene que comprar productos frescos para tener mejor calidad en los mismos.


El préstamo se utilizará para comprar fruta, pollo, verduras, panes, etre otros insumos que necesita para elaborar la venta diaria y para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa, ya  que actualmente la reciben de una casa aledaña y es su deseo tener su propia luz y mejorar la vivienda poco a poco.

Con el préstamo se hará una fuerte inversión para que su negocio cubra con las demandas que presentan las personas que visitan su negocio. Además, se logrará tener una vivienda digna que no represente ningún tipo de riesgo para sus familiares. 

En los últimos años han pasado momentos muy difíciles financieramente hablando, por ende con este nuevo proyecto pretende tener una estabilidad económica a un largo plazo; ya que en sus planes esta que su negocio se mantenga en el tiempo. Con mayores ingresos el cliente podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dar mayor seguridad y estabilidad a su familia.   

a futuro se ve siempre con su negocio y en crecimiento, que si hoy tiene un solo vendedor a futuro ella piensa tener dos y así sucesivamente aumentar. A parte desea tener un hijo mas para que su hijo no crezca solo y tenga con quien compartir el amor de sus padres, tiene la ilusión junto a su compañero de vida de seguir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco ya que necesitan repellarla para que no se laven las paredes cuando llueva, encementar el piso de su vivienda. 
Ellos tienen una vivienda de adobe la cual tiene mucho que mejorar  y con la ayuda de Fundación Campo logrará estas metas.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 19 year old young woman who has been selling bread and natural soft drinks for a number of years.  She lives with her life’s partner and they have a daughter who is less than a year old.  Besides being a housewife, she works with her husband to prepare the items for sale each day so that they can be distributed to the surrounding communities.

She buys all of the supplies she needs to make her daily sales in large quantities so that the price is better.  The price will go up and her profits will go down if she buys individually or in small quantities.  She travels to town, up to 35 km away, but there are also local stores where she can buy her supplies and not have to pay for travel every day.  She also needs to buy fresh products in order to have better quality.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fruit, chicken, vegetables, bread, and other supplies that she needs for her daily sales and to run electricity into her house.  They currently get it from a nearby home and she wants to have her own electricity and improve her house a bit.

This loan will allow her to invest in her business so that she can meet her customer demands.  She also wants to have a dignified home with no risk for her family.

She has gone through some very rough financial times in the past few years and this new project should provide long range financial stability.  Part of the plan is for the business to become self-sustaining.  This increased income will provide more security and stability to her family.
 
She sees herself as always having her business in the future.  Although she only has one salesperson now, she wants to have two in the future and increase over time.  She also plans to have another child so that her son will not grow up alone and so that he has someone to share his parents’ love with.  She and her husband want to continue improving their house little by little, since it needs repair, so that the walls don’t get wet when it rains.  They also want to install a concrete floor.
They live in an adobe house and it needs much improvement.  They will accomplish their goals with the help of Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: 24 De Diciembre El Florón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias las 10 socias y los 2 socios  del Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre del Florón, se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho en sus negocios y en su vida familiar.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María Carolina, tiene 28 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 6  años que  estudia en la escuela.  Su esposo trabaja en la empresa Eléctrica.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones, ropa y productos de catálogos de varias marcas como Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual  sale a recorrer por varios lugares de la ciudad donde tiene sus clientes que le compran con frecuencia, ella aprovecha la mañana para salir ya que a esa hora su pequeño está en la escuela, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Desde que cumplió la mayoría de edad se dedica a esta profesión la cual le ha dejado muy buenas satisfacciones y ahora con la ayuda de los créditos su situación económica ha mejorado.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones, ropa y cosméticos que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.

 Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the El Florón area of the city of Portoviejo, the ten female members and two male members of the 24 de Diciembre Community Bank of El Florón meet every two weeks. They work various jobs within the commercial and service sectors. Some time ago they decided to join together and form this credit group which has helped them a great deal in their business and in their personal lives.

One of the members of this group is Maria Carolina. She is 28 years old, married, and has a six year old son who studying in school. Her husband works for electricity company. She is a housewife who, in order to make money of her own and be able to help her husband cover household expenses, works selling sheets, blankets, clothing, and catalogue products of a variety of brands such as Avon, Yanbal, and Belcorp (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories). She sells these products door to door by going out to various parts of the city where she has customers who purchase from her regularly. She takes advantage of the morning to get out early when her young son is in school. She delivers her products on credit and collects at the end of each week. Ever since she came of age she has worked in this profession, which has brought a good deal of satisfaction and now, with the help of these loans, has improved her financial situation. 

This loan will go toward the purchase of the sheets, blankets, clothing, and cosmetics which she sells. She has been a member of the community bank since its inception and she appreciates the access it gives her for these loans. 

Her goal is to one day have her own boutique.

loans.use: purchase blankets, sheets, clothing, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Santo Domingo es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Itá, está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité, donde todas quieren salir adelante y están poniendo todo de sí.
Liliana es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que se está esforzando por cada día ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Ella vende comestibles, y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Es una persona entusiasta con muchas ansias de salir adelante.
Ella pide de esta ayuda para poder seguir con la venta de sus comestibles, y de esa forma deleitar a sus clientes como lo viene haciendo. Quiere poder comprar carne, verduras, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo is a group formed in the city of Itá. It is in its first loan cycle, and all the members hope to get ahead and are giving their all. 

Liliana is the president of this group. She is a very hardworking woman who puts forth effort everyday to improve her own life and that of her family. She sells groceries, and through great sacrifice and effort she is getting ahead. She is a very enthusiastic person with a tremendous desire to get ahead.

She is requesting assistance in order to continue selling her groceries and to continue delighting her customers as she has been doing. She wishes to be able to purchase meats, vegetables, condiments, and other products.

loans.use: purchase meats, vegetables, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Hernán Darío

texts.es: Hernán nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas y el manejo de animales, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Hoy en día, con 19 años de edad, posee cultivos de fríjol y maíz, además tiene 2 vacas productoras de leche; tanto las cosechas como la producción de leche son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside. Él trabaja diariamente cuidando sus cultivos y pendiente del ordeño de las vacas y, en el tiempo que le queda libre trabaja como jornalero con los demás agricultores de la zona. De esta forma obtiene los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades de su hogar, ya que desde hace poco vive con su compañera sentimental en unión libre. Hernán con su espíritu emprendedor y con las ganas de salir adelante, solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en compra de más vacas productoras de leche para ampliar su producción, darle continuidad a su negocio y tener la posibilidad de ampliar sus ingresos mensuales para poder brindar una estabilidad económica a su nueva familia y así seguir avanzando para mejorar la calidad de vida en un corto plazo.
texts.en:
Hernán was born and raised in the country, where he learned farm work and animal handling from his father.  Today, at the age of 19, he has bean and corn crops as well as 2 dairy cows.  He sells his harvest and his milk in his town's marketplace.  He works everyday taking care of his crops and his cows.  In his free time, he works as a day laborer with the other farmers in the area.  With this, he earns enough income to afford his household expenses since he has recently started living with his girlfriend in a common law marriage.  

Hernán, with his entrepreneurial spirit and his desire to succeed, is requesting this loan with the intention of investing it in the purchase of more dairy cows to increase his milk production, give his business continuity, and have the possibility of increasing his monthly income to provide his new family financial stability and continue moving forward to improve their quality of life in the near future.

loans.use: purchase more dairy cows to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a hairdresser who operates the beauty salon in the picture above in Ebubonku (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Araba has been working as a hairdresser for close to three years.  Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer, allowing her to meet the rising customer demands.  She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité la Esperanza se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas la Integrantes del comité se dedican a actividades agrícolas, como ser venta y cría de animales de corral.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Zulmira, quien solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gallinas para la cría y posterior venta. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza [Hope] Communal Bank was formed by the union of various neighbors of the community of the city of Santaní. All of the members of the communal bank make their living through agricultural activities, like the sale and raising of barnyard animals. 

One of them is Zulmira, who is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of hens to raise and later sell. She is very appreciative for the opportunity that she receives; this will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy hens to raise and later sell.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El progreso lleva dicho nombre, ya que todas las integrantes están luchando por el progreso de cada una, y por dar a sus familias para el día a día. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y de esa forma conocer en qué situación esta cada una.
Evangelista es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien con mucho esfuerzo y a través de su trabajo está creciendo. Ella es una integrante muy activa, que quiere poder capacitarse para mejorar su vida. Se dedica a la costura, y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que de esa forma seguirá cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group "El Progreso" (The Progress) bears said name because all of its members are fighting for the progress of each of the other members and to provide for their families day to day. They are participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" program (more information below) so that each member can become more familiar with their particular situation. 

Evangelista is one member of this group who, through her great effort and work, is growing. She is a very active member who hopes to acquire the skills necessary to improve her life. She works as a seamstress and is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabrics and threads so that she can continue fulfilling her customers' orders.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old married man and a father of four children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for 13 years. Ali is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Ali takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high quality production.

Ali is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and renovate his farm. Ali expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy livestock and develop his farm so he can give his family a good life.

The story of Ali and his business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development of clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru:
Умед житель города Истаравшан. Ему 38 лет. Умед по жизни привык всего добиваться сам. Он трудолюбивый, честный, ответственный и просто хороший человек, муж и отец троих детей. У Умеда есть машина, которая его кормит и это единственное средство дохода. Он занимается услугой такси в своем городе уже 5 лет и доволен своей работой. 
Умед просит кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину и продолжить деятельность. Он в дальнейшем хочет улучшить свое финансовое положение и накопить денег для учебы детей, чтобы его дети в будущем получили высшее образование и работали на перспективных работах.
texts.en:
Umed is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. He is 38 years old. Umed has gotten used to achieve all in life by himself. He is hardworking, honest, responsible and simply a good person, husband and father of three children.

Umed has a car, which feeds him and it is his only instrument of income. He has provided a taxi service in his village for five years already, and he is happy with his work. 

Umed requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar, in order to repair his car and continue his business. In the future he would like to improve his financial situation and save money for the education of the children. In the future he would like his children to get higher education and promising jobs.

loans.use: to repair his car to continue his business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas esta en el 1er ciclo, son un grupo muy emprendedor y que quiere ir creciendo y mejorando en lo que cada una hace. Una de ellas es la Sra. Lucila, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas.
Gracias a que ella es muy buena vendedora, es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Es emprendedora, y sabe que la forma de mejorar y crecer es trabajando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y demás, con lo que podrá seguir creciendo y teniendo así los ingresos que poder dar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is in its first cycle.  They are a group of highly entrepreneurial women that want to continue growing and improving in their respective fields.

One of the women, Lucila, is in the business of selling clothing.  Thanks to her skill as a saleswoman, her business is doing very well.  She is enterprising, and knows that the way to grow and improve is by working.  She is requesting his loan in order to invest it in the purchase of blouses, shirts, jeans, pants and other items which will allow her to continue to grow and earn an income to provide for her family.

loans.use: purchase blouses, shirts, jeans, pants and other items to sell.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 13, while the youngest is 4 months old. She engages in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice for seven years. Her husband is a driver. His income is not enough to meet the family's needs. 

Rose Marie requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers. In the future, Rose Marie would like to expand her farming business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Muhanad

texts.en:
Muhanad is a 26-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for six years. Muhanad is a hard worker; he is specialized in growing fruits and vegetables. 

Muhanad is requesting a loan of 2,700 USD. He will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and a water pump. Muhanad expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy a green house and install a drip irrigation system to save water consumption and waste.

The story of Muhanad and his business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development of clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Yohanna Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar vive la señora Yohanna, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es albañil. 

Doña Yohanna es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a varias actividades pensando en el bienestar de su familia, ella trabaja de auxiliar de enfermería en una clínica de Calceta,  pero para generar más ingresos  también  se dedica a la elaboración de bisutería y venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  también vende en el lugar donde trabaja, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
