texts.es: Jhon tiene 43 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace 18 años se trasladó de su pueblo natal y se radicó en la ciudad, con el objetivo de buscar nuevos horizontes y nuevas oportunidades para progresar. Allí, comenzó a laborar en una empresa, pero luego de 4 años, vio que el salario que ganaba no le alcanzaba para solventar las necesidades de su hogar, por lo que comenzó a vender frutas en una carreta los domingos, poco a poco fue consiguiendo clientes y le comenzó a ir mejor, por lo que decidió retirarse de la empresa y dedicarse de lleno a la venta de frutas, más adelante consiguió un punto fijo donde ubicar la carreta y allí ya lleva 14 años, trabajando todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana y durante el día cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor.  El cliente es un señor trabajador y pujante, se esmera para lograr sus objetivos, por eso se anima a solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de frutas al por mayor para aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene y así capitalizar su negocio, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento del margen de ganancias por ventas. Esto le permitirá a Jhon cumplir el sueño de brindarle a sus hijos una excelente educación universitaria, para que tengan un futuro exitoso y sean hombres de bien, además desea montar un negocio de legumbres y frutas en un local ubicado en un barrio residencial grande, así tendrá la capacidad de  brindar a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
John is 43 years old. He is the father of two children and lives in free union with his partner. Eighteen years ago he moved from the town where he was born and settled in the city, with the goal of seeking new horizons and new opportunities to progress. There he began to work in a business, but after four years, he saw that the salary he earned was not sufficient to pay for the necessities of his household. For that reason, he began to sell fruit from a cart on Sundays. Little by little, he acquired customers, and it began to go better for him, and so he decided to resign from the business and sell fruit full time. Further on, he acquired a fixed location where he could locate his cart, and he has been there for 14 years, working every day from very early in the morning and during the day. He has the help of his older son. 

The borrower is a hard-working and vigorous man. He focuses on reaching his goals, and for this reason he was encouraged to apply for the loan, with the goal of investing in the wholesale purchase of fruits to take advantage of the discounts he obtains and thus capitalize his business, which will be reflected in an increase in the earnings margin for his sales. This will allow John to accomplish his dream of offering his children an excellent university education, so that they can have a successful future and become good men. Furthermore, he wants to set up a fruit and vegetable business at a place located in a large residential neighborhood. Thus he will have the potential to offer his family a stable, favorable economy and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale

loans.name: Boneconcil

texts.en:
Boneconcil is a widow with five children that she is looking after. 

She is a farmer, who also deals in the making of the local brew, and she is requesting UGX 1,000,000 to assist her in starting another produce business to get another source of income to educate her children. She hopes that two businesses will boost her income. 

She is thankful to UGAFODE for supporting her business ventures through the loans.

loans.use: to buy maize and millet from the villages to sell during the peak season

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona, de 39 años de edad, está casada con Celso quien es empleado y padre de sus 02 hijos de 10 y 07 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan la casa de su hermana. Simona se dedica a la siembra de productos como cacao, plátano, café, entre otros. Se inició hace más de 10 año, por iniciativa propia, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su hermana con quien comparte las ganancias.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingreso y no depender únicamente de su esposo, además de apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar y brindar así una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, está ahorrando sus ganancias pues desea en un futuro abrir una tienda de comestibles en su casa, para así estar más cerca de sus hijos durante el día. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en: Simona is 39 years old. She is married to Celso who is employed and the father of her two children who are 10 and 7 years old, respectively. Together, they live in her sister's home. Simona works growing crops like cocoa, bananas and coffee, among others. She began this work more than 10 years ago on her own initiative and she currently continues doing it with the support of her sister, with whom she shares the profits. She decided to start her business because of her desire to rely on her own earnings and to not rely solely on her husband. Moreover, she wanted it to provide for the expenses of her home and to achieve a better quality of life for her family. Consequently, having seen the good results that she is having, she is saving her earnings because she wants to open a grocery store in her home in the future, to be able to be closer to her children during the day. This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She also promises to make her payments on time. With the amount of $725 that she is seeking she will buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in the town of Sinkor in Montserrado County, which is home to the capital city of Liberia and its commercial capital. She is 39 years old, married to a contractor, and the mother of seven children, who range in age from 5 to 19. Five of her children attend school and they all live at home. For the past seven years, she has earned a living by running a market where she sells rice, pepper and other food items. She started this business with help from her father and learned how to sell from him. In order to make her business more popular and earn more profits, she is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. Her goal for the future is to build a house because she already owns a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, rice and other items to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 20 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Macharia, who produces some additional income for the family. She does not have any children yet.

Millicent has a hair and beauty salon that has been in operation for the past six months. She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET, which she is going to use to buy more stock, such as hair weaves, braids and chemicals for her salon.

She is going to use the expected profit to open another salon and her hopes and dreams for the future are to create employment for other people and to have a prosperous and happy family that is financially stable.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, braids and chemicals for her salon

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Montserrado County, where the capital city of Liberia is. It is well-known as the commercial heart of Liberia. She 42 years old, married, and has two children, aged 10 and 13. Her children are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, Beatrice has been selling groceries and other goods in the local market. Her goods include, for example, slippers, flour and sugar. She started this business with help from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours a day with her business. Most of the time, she uses taxis to get her goods from home to her market table. She said of herself, "I am business-minded, and I like my business because it gives me more profit."

Beatrice is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more goods to sell, including slippers, flour and sugar. The new goods will help her to increase her sales. She wants to earn more money, in order to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her market table, including slippers, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is a young rabbit farmer from Tlaxcala interested in adopting new technologies to make his farm more economically viable. He is investing in a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to take advantage of the rabbit waste on his farm. His system will use the waste to produce renewable biofuel and potent biofertilizer, allowing him to move away from expensive and fossil-fuel based liquefied petroleum gas and agrochemical fertilizers. This loan represents 52% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, turning waste from his rabbit farm into renewable fuel and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a dairy farmer in Tlaxcala. He adds value to the milk from his cows by producing artisanal cheese. He currently uses non-renewable liquefied petroleum gas to heat the milk, but prices are rising and his profits are declining. 

He is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce his operating costs. This system will allow him to convert the abundant cow manure on-site to methane-rich renewable biofuel as well as potent biofertilizer, which he will use on his cows' feed crops. This system represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a biodigester, which will turn his cow manure into renewable biofuel and biofertilizer to support his artisanal cheese making.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.en: José Pedro is a Tlaxcalan farmer with a dairy and a greenhouse where he grows roses. He tells us he spends too much on agrochemical fertilizers, and hopes to buy a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce or eliminate his need for agrochemical fertilizers. This device will allow him to generate biofertilizer on-site using abundant cow manure. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester to turn waste into energy.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie lives in the town of Sinkor and is 30 years old, single and the mother of four children who are between 2 to 10 years old. Three of her children are in school, but all of them live at home. For the past three years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday for ten hours a day.  She started this business with money given to her by her children's father, and learned how to sell from her mother. She is requesting this loan to buy more charcoal to sell, and her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah lives in Sinkor, Liberia, in an area well-known as the commercial center of Liberia. She is 48 year old and married with six children between the ages of 18 and 31. Only one of her child is attending school and lives at home. For the past five years now she has been running a table at market where she sells door locks, nails, hinges, and others items. 

Yassah started this business with the help from her father and learned how to sell from him. She likes her business because it provides income and helps her meet many people, so she is requesting a loan to buy more door locks, nails, hinges, and others items for her business. She wants to earn more money to build a house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more door locks, nails, hinges, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Gulola

texts.ru: Гулола добросовестная женщина. Она осталась без кормильца после смерти своего мужа с одной дочкой. Гулола посвятила всю свою жизнь своей дочери. Она упорно работает для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить себя и свою дочь. Она более 4 лет работает в аэропорте. Она честно и качественно выполняет свою работу. Она имеет маленькую зарплату и поэтому не может сделать сбережения, чтобы купить мебель для дома. Она запрашивает займ для покупки мебели для домохозяйства. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulola is a conscientious woman who, along with one daughter, was left without a breadwinner after the death of her husband. Gulola has devoted her whole life to her daughter and works hard to earn money to feed them both. She has worked in the airport for more than four years and performs her work honestly and well. She earns low wages and therefore is unable to save up to buy furniture for her home. She is requesting a loan to buy household furniture. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy household furniture

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is a 46-year-old married woman. She has three children. 

She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water that will benefit ten family members. They face the challenge of insufficient water storage facilities. They will be able to store enough water for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Montserrado County, which is well known as the commercial center of Liberia. She 45 year old and married with 8 children aged between 16 and 30 years old, only one of whom is school and lives at home. For the past ten years she has been selling dry fish, pepper, etc. in the community market. She learned from her mother how to sell and started this business with the help of her husband. Julia spends 8 hours with her business each and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. 

"I am business minded person, and I like my business because it provides me and my family with income," says Julia. She is requesting a loan to buy more dry fish, pepper, etc. in order to expand her sales. She wants to earn more income and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en: Guillermo's family-owned dairy farm is struggling because of the low cost of milk in the region. The farm is his primary source of income and he is constantly looking for ways to improve his yield or reduce his costs. With his 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to displace his non-renewable liquified petroleum gas use and agrochemical fertilizer application by using renewable biogas and biofertilizer generated from the abundant cow waste he has on site. The system well help him reduce his operating costs and farm's impact on the environment. This loan represents 45% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: María Rosalba

texts.es: María a sus 58 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos y cabeza de hogar. Desde que era una niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar, pues en esa época no le daban tanta importancia al estudio, por lo que nunca terminó sus estudios primarios. Cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad, se casó y comenzó a tener hijos, pero pocos años después se separó de su esposo, porque éste no le colaboraba económicamente para solventar los gastos del hogar. Desde  hace ya 15 años, comenzó a vender frutas y verduras en una carreta y, de esta manera logró sacar adelante a todos sus hijos y con los ingresos que obtiene les ha dado la oportunidad de estudiar. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, enérgica que enfrenta los obstáculos con fortaleza y decisión, esto la impulsa para buscar opciones que le permitan seguir progresando; por esta razón, solicita el crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (zanahorias, papas, arvejas, plátanos, yuca, entre otros) con la intención de tener una gran variedad de alimentos que le permita atraer más clientes y así satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades. Esto le dará la capacidad económica para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar y en un futuro cercano poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida, que le dé la posibilidad de descansar.
texts.en: María is 58 years old, the mother of seven children and the head of the household. Ever since she was a child her parents taught her to work. When she was a child, education was not valued as much as it is today. This is why Maria didn't finish primary school. When she grew up she got married and began to have children. A short time later she separated from her husband. Her husband was not helping with the household expenses. For the last fifteen years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables from a cart. This is how she has supported her children. With the earnings from her work she has been able to give her children the opportunity to study. This client is a hardworking woman. She confronts obstacles with strength and decisiveness. This trait helps her find options that help her to move forward. This is why she is requesting this loan. She would like to invest the money in purchasing wholesale carrots, potatoes, peas, plantains and yucca among other items. She would like to sell a greater variety of food so that she can attract more customers. In this way she can meet her customer's diverse tastes and needs. This will also give her the economic capacity to sustain her home. In the near future it will provide them with a better quality of life. It may give her the opportunity to rest.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of goods wholesale (carrots, potatoes, peas, plantains and yucca among other items).

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 19 años de edad, se dedica a laborar como auxiliar de enfermería y en su tiempo libre vende mercancía y productos por catálogo de manera independiente, con la intención de generar más ingresos para aportar económicamente con los gastos de su hogar; para realizar esta actividad, cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien le ayuda a ofrecer los productos a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector. Jessica es una joven emprendedora, optimista y consciente que debe luchar con esmero y dedicación para lograr sus metas. Esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (productos cosméticos, cremas corporales, accesorios de bisutería, perfumería, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar las promociones y descuentos que le dan por compras de contado, para así tener una portafolio de productos más amplio y darle la posibilidad al cliente que lleve el producto inmediatamente, así podrá atraer más clientela y aumentará sus ventas e ingresos. De esta forma, Jessica pretende generar mejores ingresos que le permitan seguir colaborando con los gastos de su hogar y tener la capacidad de ahorrar para comprarse una moto que le facilite su traslado de un lado para otro, economizando dinero.
texts.en: Jessica is 19 years old. She works as a nursing assistant. In her free time she independently sells merchandise and products from a catalogue. She does this in order to increase her earnings. These earnings help with household expenses. She has the support of her mother for her sales activities. Her mother helps her by offering Jessica's products to her friends and neighbors. Jessica is an enterprising, optimistic and conscientious young woman. She works with great care and attention in order to achieve her goals. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise at a wholesale level (cosmetics, body creams, accessories and perfume among other items). She would like to take advantage of the promotions and discounts that are provided to those that buy with cash. This is how she can have a larger portfolio of products. Her customers could immediately obtain the products they wish to buy. This is how she can attract more customers and increase her sales and earnings. Her earnings will help with the household expenses. She will also save to buy a motorcycle, which will help her move from one place to another, saving her money on transportation.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (cosmetics,body creams, accessories, perfume and other items).

loans.name: Silenia

texts.es: Shirley, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casada, vive con su hija y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café antes de que inicie la maduración de la cosecha, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras lo más antes posible para que tengan el tiempo suficiente de lluvia y con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Shirley is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her family is her priority in life. With this loan she will buy fertilizer, fungicides and workers to help with her coffee plants before the harvest begins She will also buy some seedlings in order to start new plants. She needs to do this as soon as possible as she needs sufficient rain. She would like to increase the number of plants she has in an area in order to take advantage of the fertile soil, the climate and other things that help the coffee grow. With these improvements to her coffee plantation, she hopes to earn a bit of money and improve the conditions of her family. She would like to invest a little more in her plantation and also meet her goals. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR has offered good terms for loans and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, workers and fungicide for the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jovenes Victoriosos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jóvenes Victoriosos está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde todos están llenos de entusiasmo, con ganas de poder probar su primer emprendimiento y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles y ayudar a sus familias.
Liz es una de las integrantes, quien vende prendas en las cercanías de su casa, y por medio de esto está teniendo un pequeño ingreso que aporta a la casa. Solicita ella de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. En la foto aparece una persona mas, quien es una de las codeudora de estos jóvenes.
texts.en:
The group called Jóvenes Victoriosos (Victorious young people) is in its second cycle of the program of the youth committee, where they are all full of enthusiasm, with motivation to be able to try they first undertaking and in that way be able to feel useful and help their families. 

Liz is one of the members, who sells clothing near her home, and through this is having a small income that supports the house. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of clothing of all types, and in this way be able to continue with her sales. In the photo another person appears, who is one of the people who co-signed these young people's loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de riz, de condiments, de charbon et  de tubercules.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
La cliente MONI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 100Kg de riz avec les revendeurs de Fana, pour ensuite revendre en détail aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de riz
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up exclusively of married women with an average age of 34 years and 3 children each. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, town of Guégneka, district of Dioîla, region of Koulikoro (the second adminstrative region of the republic of Mali.)

The women came to know each other as relatives, neighbors, and friends. They are in the business of rice, spices, charcoal, and tubers. The women of the Danaya group are on their first loan.

The client Moni, second person from the left, plans to purchase 100kg of rice from the resellers in Fana, in order to resell it at retail to customers in the village and surrounding area. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA which will be used for her family's needs and a portion to be reinvested in her rice business.

loans.use: purchase rice

loans.name: Mujeres De Nazareth Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Nazareth está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de donde ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y  2 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, y luchando por mejorarlos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adelaida, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia.  Ella es limpiadora, pero está luchando por mejorar sus ingresos, es por eso que la Sra. Adelaida solicita de este crédito para la compra de comestibles, jugos, bebidas, golosinas y demás para emprender un kiosco, lo que le ayudará a  concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres de Nazareth (women of Nazareth) is in its second cycle of the program in which they are doing the survey of poverty elimination, and two women are below the poverty line, which is to say, with low income, and fighting to improve their income. 

One of the members is Adelaida, who in her last survey showed a level of poverty in level one. Through effort and continuous work she is improving her poverty situation, but at the same time she is conscious that this work and effort that she is doing should be continuous and permanent in order to achieve total success, since with it she will be able to give a better well-bring to her family. 

She is a housekeeper, but she is fighting to improve her income. For this reason, Adelaida is requesting this loan to purchase food, jioce, drinks, candy and more to start a kiosk, which will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase food, juice, drinks, candy, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay graduation expenses.

loans.name: Vitelia Yamilteh

texts.es:
Vitelia es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es viuda, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y otro de 4 años, dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando en educación básica. Ella tiene un nivel académico de noveno grado, trabaja en una empresa en limpieza de mariscos para la exportación del mismo desde hace siete años. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  madera, tejas y cementó para la construcción de su vivienda en la propiedad que su padre le otorgo.  Trasladara todos estos materiales aproximadamente unos cuatro kilómetros hasta el lugar en donde los necesita. .  

Ella tiene proyectado,  que sus hijos tengan un buen nivel académico que les permita desempeñar cualquier actividad laboral y poseer una vivienda que reúna las condicione para su familia.
texts.en:
Vitelia is a 25 year old woman who lives with her three children, ages 12, 8, and 4.  Two of them attend elementary school.  She has a ninth grade education and for seven years has been working for a seafood exporting company.

She is asking for a loan through Fundación Campo so she can buy lumber, tiles, and cement to build her house on a piece of land that her father gave her.  She will move all the materials about four km to where she needs them.

She plans for her children to have a good level of education so they can do whatever they want.  She also wants to have a house for her family.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Alicia Micaela

texts.es:
Alicia, mujer de 32 años de edad, casada con tres hijos. Estudio hasta el sexto grado en la escuela con mucho esfuerzo alcanzo este grado, por el nivel de pobreza de su familia. Su esposo es pescador al igual que sus hijos.

Desde hace 10 años, ella comercializa con mariscos que su esposo e hijos pescan y los que compra a otros pescadores. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá. Los mariscos los comercializa en su mayoría a restaurantes, es decir a compradores mayoristas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mariscos, debido a que le han efectuado pedidos y no tiene suficiente pescado para completarlo. 

Su deseo es, que sus hijos posean su equipo de pesca propio y vivir todos como una buena familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 32 years old, married and has three children.  She has a sixth grade education and got this far with great effort.  Her husband and children are fishermen and she has been selling seafood that they provide for the past 10 years.  She also buys from other fishermen, learned this from her mother, and sells mainly to restaurants; that is to large buyers.

She is asking for a loan through Fundación Campo, so she can buy more seafood because she has gotten many orders and does not have enough fish to fill them

She wants her children to have their own fishing gear and for everybody to live like a good family.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 23 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casado con Irma quien es comerciante y madre de su  hijo de 4 años de edad a quien quiere mucho.  Juntos habitan cómodamente una casa alquilada en compañía de su hermana y su sobrino. La a actividad que realiza Sara  es la venta de productos agrícolas  regionales tales como cacao, plátano, café, entre otros. Para eso instala todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa  donde acomoda sus productos y los oferta teniendo bastante acogida por su trato amable. Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por necesidad de contar con un oficio para generarse sus propios ingresos, además que en ocasiones los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba, tomando la decisión de apoyarlo con los gatos del hogar , buscando brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea continuar con su negocio e incursionar en la venta de productos comestibles para eso quiere abrir una tienda en su casa. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibirá, de esa manera se sentirá más segura para avanzar con sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará abono orgánico, semillas y plantones, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Sara is 23 years old and is a hardworking and enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead.  He is married to Irma, who is a merchant and the mother of their four year old son, whom he loves very much.  They live together comfortably in a rented house with his sister and nephew.  Sara sells farmed products such as cacao, plantains, and other things.  Every day he sets up a table in front of his house and arranges his products and offers them for sale.  He has many customers because of his friendly treatment.  He decided to start his own business out of a need to have a trade to generate his own income and because there were times when the couple’s income was not sufficient and because he wanted to provide a better quality of life for his children.  Therefore, seeing the good results he is having, he wants to continue with his business and begin selling food products by setting up a store in his home.  This will be his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support.  In this way he can move ahead with his plans.  He will use the 1,500 Soles to buy compost, seeds, and seedlings, while looking for comfortable prices so he can have good profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José es un joven de 26 años de edad, estudio hace 7 años y solo logró sacar el noveno grado. Actualmente esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. 
Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 10 años, cuando su padre, lo ponía  a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos. El trabajo lo tiene a una distancia de 50mt, eso le facilita la llegada al cultivo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 3 sacos abono, 5 litros de herbicida y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de frijol.
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estudiando para que puedan sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Jose is a 26 year old young man.  He went to school seven years ago but was only able to get to ninth grade.  He is married and has a one year old son.

He has been farming since he was 10, when his father used to put him to work in the fields, raising basic grains.  He works only 50m away, which makes it easy for him to get to the crops.

He is asking for this loan so he can buy three sacks of compost, five liters of herbicide, and pay for labor to plant his bean crop.

His dream is to see his children in school so that they can attend university.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 46 años de edad, es madre de dos hijas a quienes crió y educó sola ya que desde hace varios años se separó del que fue su esposo por mucho tiempo. El trabajo de Doris consiste en la venta de ropa de segunda mano. Su labor empieza con la compra de las prendas a distintas personas o en el mercado de la ciudad, selecciona las que están en mejor estado, luego divide las prendas femeninas y masculinas. Semanalmente se traslada en compañía de una amiga hacia los pueblos cercanos para vender su mercadería. Lleva en este negocio más de 13 años y le va muy bien. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede viajar por distintos lugares y traer también diversos productos que le regalan o intercambia con los pobladores de esos lugares, considera que lo más difícil es tener que salir muy temprano ya que a veces es peligroso. Recuerda que se inició con éste negocio debido a los bajos ingresos que había en su hogar y esto ocasionaba que no pueda brindarles una buena educación a sus hijas, pero desde que empezó a trabajar con lo que hace hasta ahora, las cosas mejoraron mucho. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera que es un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado comprará mas ropa para seguir con su negocio de venta por los caseríos principalmente vestidos para de niñas para bautismos y fiestas además de pantalones, blusas, polos, entre otros.
texts.en: Doris is 46 years old and the mother of two daughters, whom she raised and educated on her own.  She separated from her husband of many years some time ago.  Doris sells second hand clothing and her work begins with buying the items from different people in the city market.  She selects those items in best condition, then separates them into male and female items.  Every week she and a fried travel to the nearby villages to sell her merchandise.  She’s been doing this for more than 13 years and sales are going well for her, and she enjoys it because she is able to travel to different places and bring back different things that people give her or that she trades for.  She considers the most difficult part to be having to go out so early, which is sometimes risky.  She recalls that she started this business because of the low income in her home, and this prevented her from providing for a good education for her children, but things have improved since she began working.  She is grateful for this loan of S/ 2,500, and for all those who make it possible for her to move ahead with her business.  She is also grateful to her communal bank; she considers it to be a good, united, and supporting group.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more clothing for her business, mainly girls’ dresses for baptisms and parties, as well as pants, blouses, polo shirts, and other things, so she can continue selling in different neighborhoods.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gino

texts.es: Gino, de 24 años, está casado y tiene un hijo de un año, vive en casa de sus padres a lado de su esposa y sus hermanos. Gino se dedica a la edición de audio y video para conocidos programas televisivos y radiales de la región, además de alquilar su equipo de sonido y algunos otros implementos para fiestas y eventos sociales de la ciudad, parte de su trabajo consiste en realizar comerciales, sesiones fotográficas, narrar algunos documentales, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la casa de su mamá, ahí le dieron un espacio para que lo convierta en su oficina. Lleva 3 años en éste trabajo, siente que le va bien ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos además de que se divierte haciendo esto ya que es algo que le fascina desde muy niño, durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está capacitándose en nuevas técnicas de sonido y diseño, ha ganado muchos clientes y espera seguir con su etapa de crecimiento. Su meta principal es poner un estudio de sonido totalmente implementado, por lo pronto va comprando algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para su trabajo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará algunos cables que necesita renovar, realizará la reparación de un parlante y comprará focos de luces a colores que necesita para alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Gino is 24 years old, married, and has a one year old son.  He lives at his parents’ house with his wife and brothers.  Gino does video and audio editing for regional radio and television shows.   He also rents out sound equipment and other implements for parties and social events in town.  Part of his work consists of making commercials, doing photo sessions, narrating some documentaries, etc.  He does this work out of his mother’s home, where he set a space up as an office.

He’s been doing this for three years and he feels that things are going well for him since his customer base has increased.  What he enjoys about his work is that it generates a good income for him and he always has fun doing it because it’s something that has fascinated since he was a child.  He has learned many things by doing this, and he continues training in new sound and design techniques.  He’s gained many customers and he hopes to continue his growth phase.

His goal is to set up a completely equipped studio and he has already purchased some equipment that he needs for his work.  He is asking for a loan of S/ 800 and he is happy and grateful to know that he has financial support so he can continue his business.  He will use the money to buy some cables that he needs to replace.  He will also buy some colored lights that he needs to he can rent them out.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts.

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this set of teachers located in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to apply for a loan of SLL 4,900,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.  It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

James is the featured leader of group. Born in 1974, James is married and has four children – two of his children are attending secondary school and two are not yet of school age. James has been a school teacher for five years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouman, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des parfums, du charbon de bois, des condiments, des céréales et du lait de vache.                                                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FANTA, deuxième première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter  10Kg de Gueni, 2Kg de Magnon kisseni et  5 Bidons d’eau de Cologne le plus souvent avec les fournisseurs de Bamako et de Fana, pour ensuite revendre aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie de ses activités.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouman group is made up exclusively of married women with an average age of 27 years and 3 children each. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, town of Guégneka, prefecture of Dioîla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the republic of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They are in the business of perfume, charcoal, spices, grains, and cow's milk. The women of the group are on their third group loan.

Fanta, the second person from the left in the row of seated women in the photo, plans to purchase 10kg of "gueni", 2kg of "magnon kisseni" (a plant), and 5 bottles of perfume, most often from the sellers in Bamako and Fana, in order to resell them to customers of the village and surrounding area. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA which she will use for her family's needs and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase various items

loans.name: Denny

texts.en:
Denny is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost six years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) in one of the rural villages in Samana. She has received ten loans to invest in her business selling jewels.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program in which most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house, while running their business loans and attending groups meetings. 

Denny is a single woman with  a child. Years ago she started building her house, and now is requesting a loan to have her house roof finished. With this loan she will purchase cement, sand and rods, and will also pay for the building labor and other building materials. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy cement, rods, gravel, etc

loans.name: Sabaty Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Sabaty” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Feremusu is the featured leader of this group. She is 38, and married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Feremusu sells cloths/clothes and has been doing this business for nine years now. 

With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying different kinds of cloths/clothes in large quantities for her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of cloths/clothes and in large quantities for her business

loans.name: Willian De Jesús

texts.es: Willian, a sus 54 años de edad, se dedica a vender mercancía en una carreta ubicada en una calle principal del municipio donde reside. Ofrece todo tipo de artículos para uso doméstico como controles de televisor, cuchillos, pilas, accesorios para el cabello, entre otros. Esta actividad la aprendió de unos familiares que se dedicaban a la misma labor y, la realiza desde hace 6 años. De esta manera ha podido generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. El cliente es un hombre pujante y dedicado a su labor, trabaja solo todos los días de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm y manifiesta que hasta el momento le ha dado muy buenos resultados. Actualmente solicita el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de más mercancía al por mayor (controles, cuchillos, pilas, sombrillas, accesorios), con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y atraer más clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de las ventas y por ende, el margen de ganancias que obtendrá. De esta manera Willian espera poder hacer crecer su negocio y montarlo en un local propio, que le permita mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y los clientes puedan estar mejor atendidos, esto le brindará la capacidad económica para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Willian, at the age of 54, sells merchandise from a cart located on one of the main streets of the town where he lives. He offers every type of article for household use, such as television controllers, knives, batteries, and hair accessories, among other items. He learned this business from some relatives who do the same work, and he has been doing it for six years. In this way he has been able to generate income to pay for the household necessities. 

This borrower is a vigorous man, dedicated to his work. He works alone every day from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, and he states that up to now [his business] has given him very good results Now he is applying for a loan that he wants to invest in the purchase of more merchandise (television controllers, knives, batteries, umbrellas, and accessories) wholesale, with the goal of expanding his portfolio of products and attracting more customers, which will be reflected in an increase in sales, and in the end, the earnings margin that he will obtain. In this way Willian hopes to be able to make his business grow and set it up in his own shop, which would allow him to improve working conditions, and the customers could be served better. This will offer him the economic potential to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (television controllers, knives, batteries, umbrellas, accessories) wholesale

loans.name: Margerette I.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 10,800,000 for the entire team. With the the help of this loan, each of them will be able to meet his or her most immediate financial challenges and at the end of the month, he/she can repay the loan using his/her salary. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.
 
Margerette is the featured leader of this group. Fifty-year-old Margerette is married to a schoolteacher and the couple has 5 children, 2 of whom are attending colleges. Margerette is a schoolteacher and has been in the teaching profession for 30 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay her children’s college fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s college fees

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

His family faces a challenge of lack of enough water. He hopes that in the future, he will have a clean and sufficient water supply.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número 1° del programa de comités, ellas están empezando a conocerse y a trabajar juntas, tienen un gran entusiasmo y han visto una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité que les ayudará a conocer y poder mejorar sus microemprendimientos.
Petrona es artesana en karanday (planta similar a palmera) es una persona muy hábil en lo que hace, y lo que más le gusta es que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, y les da todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y que no pasen por privaciones. Ella pide de esta ayuda para la compra de karanday, hilos, tijeras y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías y teniendo así los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Rosa Mistica is in its first cycle with the committee program. They are starting to get to know one another and to work together. They are very enthusiastic and have seen great opportunity in this program that will help them to learn and to improve their small businesses. 

Petrona is an artisan who works with karanday (a plant similar to the palm). She is very good at what she does, and what she likes most is that through her work she helps her family and gives them what they need in order to have a dignified life and not lack anything. She asks for this help to buy karanday, thread, scissors and other inputs so that she can keep making her crafts and having the income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy karanday reeds to make crafts.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрату 38 лет. Он в своем районе Гиссар занимается торговлей. Шухрат женат и имеет двоих детей. Старший ходит в школу в первый класс, а второй еще маленький. Шухрат арендует помещение для магазина. Там он продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары, такие как растительное и топленое масло, печенье, шоколад, чай, дрожжи, мыло, стиральный порошок, средство для мытья посуды и т.д. Шухратчон занимается продажей в течение трех лет и его бизнес хорошо продвигается. Ему помогает в этом деле его супруга. Он просит кредит для развития бизнеса. В будущем Шухрат хочет приобрести арендуемый магазин под свою собственность.
texts.en: Shuhrat is 38 years old.  He is a salesman in his area, Gissar.  Shuhrat is married and has two children.  The older one is in first grade at school and the younger one is still small.  Shuhrat rents a space for his store.  He sells groceries and household supplies, such as vegetable oil and melted butter, cookies, chocolate, tea, yeast, soap, laundry detergent, dishwashing soap, etc.  Shuhrat has been working in sales for three years and his business is going well.  His wife helps him with his business.  He is asking for a loan to expand his business.  In the future Shuhrat would like to purchase the store that he rents.

loans.use: to buy groceries and household supplies to grow his business

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le Djiguiya, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de des condiments, des céréales et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des céréales et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
La cliente MAÏMOUNA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout,  compte acheter 15Kg d’oignon, 10Kg de poisson fumé, un sac de sel gemme et d’autres condiments avec les fournisseurs de Fana, pour ensuite revendre aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans ses activités
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed exclusively of married women, who average 31 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Commune de Guégneka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, grains, and charcoal. 

The women of the group Djiguiya are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase condiments, grains, and charcoal.

This client, MAÏMOUNA, who is standing in the middle, intends to purchase 15 kg of onions, 10 kg of smoked fish, a bag of rock salt, and other condiments from Fana suppliers. She will then sell the goods to customers in and around the village. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, and part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yiriwa, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide, des condiments, de savon, de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
La cliente DJELIKA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout,  compte acheter deux sacs d’arachide avec les fournisseurs de Fana, pour ensuite revendre aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide
texts.en:
The group Yiriwa is composed exclusively of married women, who average 32 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Commune de Guégneka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in peanuts, condiments, soap, firewood, and charcoal. The women of the group Yiriwa are on their third solidarity loan.

This client, DJELIKA, who is standing first from the left, intends to purchase 2 sacks of peanuts from Fana suppliers. She will then sell the goods to customers in and around the village. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, and part will be reinvested in her peanut business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to sell

loans.name: Norqueza

texts.en:
Norqueza is 59 years old and widowed with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Norqueza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Norqueza has been farming rice for 16 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Analyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Yusufu R.

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Yusufu R. He is married and has 4 children aged 21, 18, 16, and 12 years; 3 are school-going children. 

In 2005, Yusufu R. established his Palm Oil business. He began his business because he could not further his studies because of lack of finance. His elder sister advised him to join her husband's business instead of sitting at home idling, and he thought it a wise decision. Several years later he decided to be independent and was successful.  

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le984,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Yusufu R. requires a loan in order to purchase rubbers [plastic containers] of palm oil. In the future, Yusufu R. plans to expand his business. Shortage in supply of goods is his major challenge. The loan is an additional income; he thanks this credit service to enable him acquire a loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rubbers of palm oil.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат молодая и энергичная леди. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Мухаббат в 2009 году окончила среднюю школу успешно, но по семейному обстоятельству не смогла поступить в университет, чтобы получить высшее образование. Она научилась у портнихи шитью и кройки женской одежды. Она более 6 лет занимается услугой портнихи, а также продает свою продукцию на местном рынке. Мухаббат знает все тонкости своего дела и шьёт на высшем уровне. Она планирует развевать свой бизнес, а для этого ей необходимо купить ткани и шить больше платьев. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhabbat is a young and energetic lady.  She is 21 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Muhabbat successfully finished high school in 2009, but due to family circumstances was not able to start university to get a higher education.  She learned sewing and cutting of women's clothing from a seamstress.  She has been a seamstress for over 6 years and also sells her products at the local market.  Muhabbat knows all the details of her work and sews products of the highest quality.  She plans to grow her business and needs to buy fabrics and to sew more dresses.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni for the purchase of fabric.  She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing women's dresses

loans.name: Gihororo Group

texts.fr:
Rose  fait partie du groupe  Gihororo et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une divorcée de 40 ans. Elle a 3 enfants  âgés de 12 à 15 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce d’huile de palme depuis 12 ans. 

Elle est cliente à Turame depuis 7 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 15 bidons  d'huile de palme de  20 litres chacun, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rose is part of the group Gihororo and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and divorced, and she has three children, from 12 to 15 years old, all students

Rose has been doing commerce in palm oil for twelve years. 

She has been a Turame client for seven years. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase fifteen 20-liter containers of palm oil to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a member of the group called Mujeres hacia el progreso, which is located in a rural area of the city of Samana. This is his fifth loan, which he will use to build his house. He has had a business selling fruits and vegetables, started from his savings, for over four years, but now he is running a grocery store.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and have shown fidelity to their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve their home at the same time they run their business and attnd their group meetings. Elias is a single man and is also in school. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Elias realized the need to improve his home. With this housing loan, he can pay for the improvements and save to do more. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan, which he will use to build his house on the second floor of his parent's house. He will use this loan to buy concrete blocks, cement and other building materials to start building first one or two rooms. He thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, sand and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rubbers of palm oil.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné mariée à un transitaire vit à Lomé avec ce dernier et leurs 02 enfants. Ils sont âgés de 04 et 02ans, seul l'ainé est scolarisé. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle a commencé la vente des produits cosmétiques et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Elle espère investir dans son activité et améliorer les besoins vitaux de la famille. Elle a 21ans.
texts.en: Akpéné, married to a shipping agent, lives in Lomé with him and their two children, who are 4 and 2 years old. Only the oldest child is in school. To help her husband to cover household expenses, she started selling cosmetics. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She hopes to invest in her business and do better meeting the family's vital needs. She is 21 years old.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group

texts.en:
Manjulata is 30 years old and lives in Tetelkhunti village in the Balangir district of Odisha, India. Tetelkhunti is a remotely located rural village. The lady standing third from right with her hand raised in the photograph is Manjulata. She belongs to a poor family and is a very active and energetic lady. She lives with her husband, one son who is eight years old and one daughter who is five years old.  Manjulata has been running a general store in her village for the last two years. She started her small business in a wooden stall with 4,000 INR of her own. In the year 2011, she and five members of her village formed a group named Thakurani to avail loans from Mahashakti foundation. She has already taken the first loan and has been able to give a new look to her shop by increasing the stock. She sells general grocery items like oil, sugar, tea, soap, washing powder, lentils, biscuits, toffees, eggs, etc. Her husband is a mason who always used to move outside for his work. So Manjulata manages her house as well as the business. Her net monthly income from the existing business is 4,000 INR. Out of this income, she barely manages her business as well as her household expenses. Manjulata purchases stock for her business on a weekly basis from the wholesalers in the nearest town, which is 15 kms away.  She wants to increase her stock with this second loan of 14,000 INR by purchasing items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. Manjulata hopes this will help her to increase her income and realize her dreams by constructing a permanent cabin for her business and providing a better education for her children.

The other five borrowers in the group are Surudei, Nilendri, Minakhi, Banti and Binodini, who have a puffed rice business, a fish vending business, a tailoring center, a fast food center and a vegetable vending business, respectively

loans.use: To purchase oil, sugar, tea dust, washing powder, lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc.

loans.name: Jesus-Kpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUS-KPEGO est composé de neuf membres qui vivent  dans le même village.  La représentante  de ce groupement, du nom de Angeline (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) âgée de 24 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Angeline est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Lucien. Le couple a un enfant, qui n’est pas scolarisé et à leur charge. Angeline vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que depuis deux ans, Angeline vend des tissus et des plastiques par la méthode de distribution dans sa région. Angeline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Angeline ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESUS-KPEGO sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group JESUS-KPEGO is composed of nine members who live in the same village. The group's representative, Angeline (with her hand raised in the photo), is 24 years old and has a middle school education. With the goal of boosting their business in order to cope with the  demands of their customer, this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time. 

Angeline is married to a mechanic named Lucien. The couple have one child, who is not in school but in their care. Angeline lives together with her husband and child. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. For this reason, Angeline has been selling cloth and plasticware by the distribution method in her region for two years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of increasing her level of business and satisfying her customers, Angeline along with the other members of the group JESUS-KPEGO are requesting an initial loan fro ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Edjromahou Group

texts.fr: EDJROMAHOU est groupement composé de vingt personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Yélian (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Yélian est veuve et vit seule. Pour satisfaire ses besoins, Yélian vend de la nourriture de façon ambulante. Yélian s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Yélian ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement EDJROMAHOU sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group EDJROMAHOU is composed of twenty members who reside in the same village. The group's representative, Yélian (with her hand raised in the photo), is 24 years old and did not attended school. With the goal of boosting their business in order to cope with the  demands of their customer, this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé for a second time. 

Yélian is a widow and live alone. To support herself, she sells food door to door. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of increasing her level of business and satisfying her customers, Yélian along with the other members of the group EDJROMAHOU are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The past loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase fish and staple foods

loans.name: Maa Baisnabi Group

texts.en:
The Maa Baisnabi Joint Liability Group was formed in 2013 by four active women of Titilagarh town in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their existing businesses. Among the four members, two are old members who have already taken their first loan from Mahashakti in 2011 and two members are new. Kakaya, about 48 years old, is one of the members. The lady standing on the extreme right in the photo, raising her hand, is Kakaya. She is one of the old members of Mahashakti Foundation. She lives with her husband and her three sons aged 19, 15 and 13 years old. All her children are continuing their studies in the local college and school.

Kakaya has been running a general store in her locality for the last 15 years with the help of her husband. She sells general grocery items like rice, oil, sugar, tea, soap, washing powder, lentils, biscuits, soft drinks, toffees, eggs, etc. All types of daily need items are available in her store. Her husband is a very amicable person. He is always cheerful with the customers.  Her net monthly income from the existing business is Rs.10,000. Out of this income, she has been able to contribute to the household expenses like the educational expenses of her children. Kakaya purchases stock for her business on a weekly basis from the wholesalers in her town. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase the stock in her business with this loan by purchasing items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. for her general store from the nearest wholesale market, which is 200 kms away. This will help her to reduce her purchasing costs and save time as she has to refill her stock frequently. Kakaya dreams of providing a better education to her children as she believes that education is the pillar of all success. The other three members of the group are Malati, Basanti and Ratna. They are running a Tiffin stall, a bamboo basket making and selling business and a tailoring business, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, eggs etc.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.es:
Shirly de 28 años de edad, se dedica  a la elaboración y ventas de bolsos sintéticos, desde hace 10 años. Shirly habita con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 5 a 9 años.en un barrio muy tradicional y de espíritu carnavalero, que combina el comercio formal e informal, conjuntos habitacionales,y que ubica a uno de los escenarios deportivos mas importantes de futbol profesional Colombiano, donde juega el equipo amado de los costeños del país: el Junior de Barranquilla. La experiencia de Shirley, data del aprendizaje que de su cónyuge provino y con quien decidió emprender y acompañar esta actividad productiva, ubicando un taller en su hogar, para beneficiar aun mas a su familia, mediante la  atención de su hogar simultáneamente, mientras su cónyuge trabaja empleado en una fábrica y la apoya en sus actividades productivas al mismo tiempo.
Los principales productos  de su oferta, son los bolsos sintéticos, de lona que vende al por mayor y al detal, a crédito y de contado a una clientela fija, que poco a poco ha construido. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar su infraestructura física y aumentar su capital de trabajo. A nivel familiar se proyecta a aumentar la calidad en la educación de sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales sintéticos, correderas, hebillas, lonas, pegantes e hilos. Su crédito será un éxito, porque aumentará su liquidez, para producir, sus ventas y aun mejor sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Shirly, 28, has been making and selling synthetic bags for 10 years. Shirly lives with her 3 children ages 5 to 9, in a traditional neighborhood with a carnival spirit, that combines formal and informal commerce together with residences, alongside one of the most important sports arenas in professional Colombian soccer, where the team beloved by the coastal residents plays: Junior de Barranquilla. Shirley's experience, which she learned from her spouse with whom she decided to start this business out of a workshop in her home, allows her to benefit her family. Her partner works in a factory and also helps her with her business. 

The main products that she offers are synthetic bags made of canvas that she sells in bulk and retail, on credit or for cash to a regular clientele that she has built little by little. Her goal for the future is to improve her physical infrastructure and increase her business capital. At the familial level, she plans to increase the quality of her children's education. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy synthetic materials, zippers, buckles, adhesives and thread. Her loan will be a success because it will increase her liquidity for production, her sales, and her profits.

loans.use: to buy synthetic materials, zippers, canvas, adhesive and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients and furniture and to pay wages for his four-member team.

loans.name: Eddy  José

texts.es:
Eddy es una persona dedicada por entero a la enseñanza de los niños, ya que su profesión es maestro de educación  primaria y labora en un centro escolar de su localidad, es casado  con 3 hijos a los que le está apoyando en su desarrollo, 

actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda construyendo una tapia para evitar que en esta temporada lluviosa se le inunde, por eso se acerco a las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un financiamiento y lograr la mejora que tanto desea, ya que lo utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción tales como piedra cantera , hierro3/8 varilla 3/8 , varilla ¼, cemento , arena y mano de obra y de esa manera mejorar su situación  familiar.
texts.en:
Eddy is completely dedicated to children's education, working as a primary school teacher at a learning center in his town. He is married and has 3 children who he is supporting as they develop.

Currently he needs to improve his home, building a wall to prevent flooding during the rainy season. For this reason he went to the offices of Ceprodel to get a loan and make the improvements he wants. He will buy construction materials like quarry stone, 3/8 iron, 3/8 and 1/4 rebar, cement, sand and labor, so that he can improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like quarry stone, 3/8" iron, 3/8' and 1/4' rebar, cement, sand, and labor.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 33 years old and married with two children.

Madelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Madelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from fishing.

Madelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, soap, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Vilma Milagros

texts.en:
Vilma is a diligent, punctual, and responsible young 20-year-old. She recently finished her technical degree in accounting at a local institution and is excited about the doors it will open for her professionally. Vilma currently works as an accounting assistant at a mining firm in the region. She enjoys her job since it allows her to put to use the skills she learned during her studies. 

Although Vilma has completed her degree, she still needs to cover some of the school fees before her title becomes official. Thanks to Kiva lenders, Vilma will finally be able to pay the outstanding costs of schooling and move forward with her professional life. She is extremely grateful and motivated by this support.

loans.use: to cover the cost of some university fees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 27 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Agnes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Agnes has been raising pigs for one year and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abdul K.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abdul K. He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3 years; one is a school-going child. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because they are also school-going children, and they also help in domestic work.  

In 2004, Abdul K. established his building materials (cements, iron rods, etc.) business. He began his business because he was lucky to have a job after his tertiary education.
