After two years of work service, he decided to resign. The salary he was earning was not enough to take care of his family. He started his business, which has successfully grown over the years.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,064,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abdul K. requires a loan in order to purchase tons of iron rods and bags of cement. 

In the future, Abdul K. plans to expand his business and give his children a good education. Shortage in supply of goods is his challenge. His business requires a larger amount of capital, and he is hoping to get subsequent loans to boost his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tons of iron rods and bags of cement.

loans.name: Fatmata M.

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Fatmata M. She is married and has five children, aged 23, 19, 16, 13 and 9 years; four are school-going children. In 1991, Fatmata M. established her cooking utensils business. She began her business because after school hours, she used to help her mother in her business. Thinking that doing business is more of an advantage, she decided to drop out of school. Her mother did not advise her to continue her education; she encouraged her because she needed more hands in running the business. 

She got married at a younger age and set up her own business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 605,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Fatmata M. requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of enamel pans and other utensils. In the future, Fatmata M. plans to give her children a quality education and open a shop. As competition is very high, the loan will help her manage her business effectively. She is looking forward to acquiring subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of enamel pans and other utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for construction materials to fix his home.

loans.name: Daniel Cristobal

texts.en:
Daniel, 27, is a resident of Pucallpa (“red earth” in Quechua), which is located on the bank of the Ucayali River in the Amazon rainforest of Peru. 

Currently, Daniel works for the provincial government and recently completed his post-secondary studies in administration and accounting. Daniel’s main focus and goal is to rise in the ranks within the government, something that he cannot achieve until he is officially granted his university degree. To finally receive his degree, Daniel must pay additional fees, which is why he is taking out this loan. He is extremely grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, as it motivates him to continue working hard to achieve his goals and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (Kuña Kyre´y ) está en su ciclo número (1) del programa de comité de mujeres, surgió gracias a promociones realizada en la zona y también gracias a las ganas de crecer que tienen todas.
La Sra. Pastora, es la Presidenta del grupo. Ella alienta a las demás compañeras a luchar por sus objetivos  para llegar al éxito deseado. Tiene como actividad “Cría de Pollo” y de esa forma tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy entusiasta y con grandes ganas de ir mejorando.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de Pollos para criar, esto le ayudará a mantener una actividad estable, que le permitirá aumentar su ingreso y elevar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña Kyre´y"  is in their first cycle with Women’s Committee program. It was created thanks to promotions put on in their area and the desire of the members to grow. Pastora is the president of the group. She encouraged the others to fight for their goals, in order to achieve the desired results. 

Her business is raising chickens. From this she generates the income she needs to help support her family. She is a very enthusiastic individual with a strong desire to get ahead. Pastora is requesting this loan to buy chickens to raise. This will help her keep her business activity going which will allow her to increase her revenues and raise the standard of living for her whole family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Safira

texts.en: Safira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soy sauce, vinegar and other groceries. Safira has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling bananas. Safira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store such as canned goods, eggs, soy sauce, vinegar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is 48-years-old and married with six children; three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Beverly is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed. She has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her livestock activity.

loans.name: Leny Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, five of whom are in school, Leny Joy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Leny Joy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.
